<s> I cry unto thee , and thou dost not hear me : I stand up , and thou
regardest me not . </s>
<s> Thou art become cruel to me : with thy strong hand thou opposest
thyself against me . </s>
<s> Thou liftest me up to the wind ; thou causest me to ride upon it ,
and dissolvest my substance . </s>
<s> For I know that thou wilt bring me to death , and to the house
appointed for all living . </s>
<s> Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave , though
they cry in his destruction . </s>
<s> Did not I weep for him that was in trouble ? </s>
<s> was not my soul
grieved for the poor ? </s>
<s>  When I looked for good , then evil came
unto me : and when I waited for light , there came darkness . </s>
<s> My bowels boiled , and rested not : the days of affliction
prevented me . </s>
<s> I went mourning without the sun : I stood up , and I cried in the

<s> I am a brother to dragons , and a companion to owls . </s>
<s> My skin is black upon me , and my bones are burned with heat . </s>
<s> My harp also is turned to mourning , and my organ into the voice

<s> I made a covenant with mine eyes ; why then should I think upon a

<s>  For what portion of God is there from above ? </s>
<s> and what
inheritance of the Almighty from on high ? </s>
<s>  Is not destruction to
the wicked ? </s>
<s> and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity ? </s>
<s> 
Doth not he see my ways , and count all my steps ? </s>
<s>  If I have
walked with vanity , or if my foot hath hasted to deceit ; Let me
be weighed in an even balance that God may know mine integrity . </s>
<s> If my step hath turned out of the way , and mine heart walked
after mine eyes , and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands ; Then
let me sow , and let another eat ; yea , let my offspring be rooted out . </s>
<s> If mine heart have been deceived by a woman , or if I have laid
wait at my neighbour 's door ; Then let my wife grind unto
another , and let others bow down upon her . </s>
<s> For this is an heinous crime ; yea , it is an iniquity to be
punished by the judges . </s>
<s> For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction , and would root

<s> If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my
maidservant , when they contended with me ; What then shall I do
when God riseth up ? </s>
<s> and when he visiteth , what shall I answer him ? </s>
<s> Did not he that made me in the womb make him ? </s>
<s> and did not one
fashion us in the womb ? </s>
<s>  If I have withheld the poor from their
desire , or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail ; Or have

father , and I have guided her from my mother 's womb ;) If I have
seen any perish for want of clothing , or any poor without covering ;
 If his loins have not blessed me , and if he were not warmed with
the fleece of my sheep ; If I have lifted up my hand against the
fatherless , when I saw my help in the gate : Then let mine arm
fall from my shoulder blade , and mine arm be broken from the bone . </s>
<s> For destruction from God was a terror to me , and by reason of
his highness I could not endure . </s>
<s> If I have made gold my hope , or have said to the fine gold , Thou
art my confidence ; If I rejoice because my wealth was great , and
because mine hand had gotten much ; If I beheld the sun when it
shined , or the moon walking in brightness ; And my heart hath
been secretly enticed , or my mouth hath kissed my hand : This
also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge : for I should have
denied the God that is above . </s>
<s> If I rejoice at the destruction of him that hated me , or lifted
up myself when evil found him : Neither have I suffered my mouth
to sin by wishing a curse to his soul . </s>
<s> If the men of my tabernacle said not , Oh that we had of his
flesh ! </s>
<s> we cannot be satisfied . </s>
<s> The stranger did not lodge in the street : but I opened my doors
to the traveller . </s>
<s> If I covered my transgressions as Adam , by hiding mine iniquity
in my bosom : Did I fear a great multitude , or did the contempt
of families terrify me , that I kept silence , and went not out of the

<s>  Oh that one would hear me ! </s>
<s> behold , my desire is , that the
Almighty would answer me , and that mine adversary had written a book . </s>
<s> Surely I would take it upon my shoulder , and bind it as a crown

<s> I would declare unto him the number of my steps ; as a prince

<s> If my land cry against me , or that the furrows likewise thereof
complain ; If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money , or
have caused the owners thereof to lose their life : Let thistles
grow instead of wheat , and cockle instead of barley . </s>
<s> words of Job are ended . </s>
<s> So these three men ceased to answer Job , because he was righteous
in his own eyes . </s>
<s> Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the
Buzite , of the kindred of Ram : against Job was his wrath kindled ,
because he justified himself rather than God . </s>
<s> Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled , because
they had found no answer , and yet had condemned Job . </s>
<s> Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken , because they were elder
than he . </s>
<s> When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these
three men , then his wrath was kindled . </s>
<s> And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said , I am
young , and ye are very old ; wherefore I was afraid , and durst not shew
you mine opinion . </s>
<s> I said , Days should speak , and multitude of years should teach
wisdom . </s>
<s> But there is a spirit in man : and the inspiration of the Almighty
giveth them understanding . </s>
<s> Great men are not always wise : neither do the aged understand
judgment . </s>
<s> Therefore I said , Hearken to me ; I also will shew mine opinion . </s>
<s> Behold , I waited for your words ; I gave ear to your reasons ,

<s> Yea , I attended unto you , and , behold , there was none of you
that convinced Job , or that answered his words : Lest ye should

<s> Now he hath not directed his words against me : neither will I

<s> They were amazed , they answered no more : they left off speaking . </s>
<s> When I had waited , (for they spake not , but stood still , and

<s> For I am full of matter , the spirit within me constraineth me . </s>
<s> Behold , my belly is as wine which hath no vent ; it is ready to

<s> I will speak , that I may be refreshed : I will open my lips and

<s> Let me not , I pray you , accept any man 's person , neither let me
give flattering titles unto man . </s>
<s> For I know not to give flattering titles ; in so doing my maker
would soon take me away . </s>
<s> Wherefore , Job , I pray thee , hear my speeches , and hearken to all

<s> Behold , now I have opened my mouth , my tongue hath spoken in my

<s> My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart : and my lips

<s> The spirit of God hath made me , and the breath of the Almighty

<s> If thou canst answer me , set thy words in order before me , stand

<s> Behold , I am according to thy wish in God 's stead : I also am

<s> Behold , my terror shall not make thee afraid , neither shall my

<s> Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing , and I have heard the

<s> Behold , he findeth occasions against me , he counteth me for his

<s> Behold , in this thou art not just : I will answer thee , that God
is greater than man . </s>
<s> Why dost thou strive against him ? </s>
<s> for he giveth not account of
any of his matters . </s>
<s> For God speaketh once , yea twice , yet man perceiveth it not . </s>
<s> In a dream , in a vision of the night , when deep sleep falleth
upon men , in slumberings upon the bed ; Then he openeth the ears
of men , and sealeth their instruction , That he may withdraw man
from his purpose , and hide pride from man . </s>
<s> He keepeth back his soul from the pit , and his life from
perishing by the sword . </s>
<s> He is chastened also with pain upon his bed , and the multitude
of his bones with strong pain : So that his life abhorreth bread ,
and his soul dainty meat . </s>
<s> His flesh is consumed away , that it cannot be seen ; and his
bones that were not seen stick out . </s>
<s> Yea , his soul draweth near unto the grave , and his life to the
destroyers . </s>
<s> If there be a messenger with him , an interpreter , one among a
thousand , to shew unto man his uprightness : Then he is gracious
unto him , and saith , Deliver him from going down to the pit : I have
found a ransom . </s>
<s> His flesh shall be fresher than a child 's : he shall return to
the days of his youth : He shall pray unto God , and he will be
favourable unto him : and he shall see his face with joy : for he will
render unto man his righteousness . </s>
<s> He looketh upon men , and if any say , I have sinned , and
perverted that which was right , and it profited me not ; He will
deliver his soul from going into the pit , and his life shall see the
light . </s>
<s> Lo , all these things worketh God oftentimes with man , To
bring back his soul from the pit , to be enlightened with the light of
the living . </s>
<s> Mark well , O Job , hearken unto me : hold thy peace , and I will
speak . </s>
<s> If thou hast anything to say , answer me : speak , for I desire to
justify thee . </s>
<s> If not , hearken unto me : hold thy peace , and I shall teach thee

<s> Furthermore Elihu answered and said , Hear my words , O ye
wise men ; and give ear unto me , ye that have knowledge . </s>
<s> For the ear trieth words , as the mouth tasteth meat . </s>
<s> Let us choose to us judgment : let us know among ourselves what is

<s> For Job hath said , I am righteous : and God hath taken away my

<s> Should I lie against my right ? </s>
<s> my wound is incurable without

<s> What man is like Job , who drinketh up scorning like water ? </s>
<s> 
Which goeth in company with the workers of iniquity , and walketh with

<s> For he hath said , It profiteth a man nothing that he should

<s> Therefore hearken unto me ye men of understanding : far be it

<s> For the work of a man shall he render unto him , and cause every

<s> Yea , surely God will not do wickedly , neither will the Almighty

<s> Who hath given him a charge over the earth ? </s>
<s> or who hath disposed

<s>  If he set his heart upon man , if he gather

<s> Shall even he that hateth right govern ? </s>
<s> and wilt thou condemn

<s>  Is it fit to say to a king , Thou art

<s> and to princes , Ye are ungodly ? </s>
<s>  How much less to him

<s> for they all are the work of his hands . </s>
<s> In a moment shall they die , and the people shall be troubled at

<s> For his eyes are upon the ways of man , and he seeth all his

<s> There is no darkness , nor shadow of death , where the workers of

<s> For he will not lay upon man more than right ; that he should

<s> He shall break in pieces mighty men without number , and set

<s> Therefore he knoweth their works , and he overturneth them in the

<s> He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others ;

<s> When he giveth quietness , who then can make trouble ? </s>
<s> and when he
hideth his face , who then can behold him ? </s>
<s> whether it be done against a
nation , or against a man only : That the hypocrite reign not ,

<s> Surely it is meet to be said unto God , I have borne

<s> Should it be according to thy mind ? </s>
<s> he will recompense it ,
whether thou refuse , or whether thou choose ; and not I : therefore

<s> Let men of understanding tell me , and let a wise man hearken

<s> My desire is that Job may be tried unto the end because of his

<s> For he addeth rebellion unto his sin , he clappeth his hands

<s> Elihu spake moreover , and said , Thinkest thou this to be

For thou saidst , What advantage will it be unto thee ? </s>
<s> and , What profit

<s>  I will answer thee ,

<s> or what receiveth he of thine

<s>  Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art ; and thy

<s> By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make the oppressed

<s> But none saith , Where is God my maker , who giveth songs in the

<s>  There they cry , but

<s> Surely God will not hear vanity , neither will the Almighty

<s> Although thou sayest thou shalt not see him , yet judgment is

<s> Elihu also proceeded , and said , Suffer me a little , and I

<s> For truly my words shall not be false : he that is perfect in

<s> Behold , God is mighty , and despiseth not any : he is mighty in

<s> He preserveth not the life of the wicked : but giveth right to the

<s> He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous : but with kings

<s> And if they be bound in fetters , and be holden in cords of

<s> He openeth also their ear to discipline , and commandeth that

<s> If they obey and serve him , they shall spend their days in

<s> But if they obey not , they shall perish by the sword , and they

<s> But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath : they cry not when he

<s> They die in youth , and their life is among the unclean . </s>
<s> He delivereth the poor in his affliction , and openeth their ears

<s> Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait into a

<s> But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked : judgment and

<s> Because there is wrath , beware lest he take thee away with his

<s> Will he esteem thy riches ? </s>
<s> no , not gold , nor all the forces of
strength . </s>
<s> Desire not the night , when people are cut off in their place . </s>
<s> Take heed , regard not iniquity : for this hast thou chosen rather
than affliction . </s>
<s> Behold , God exalteth by his power : who teacheth like him ? </s>
<s> 
Who hath enjoined him his way ? </s>
<s> or who can say , Thou hast wrought
iniquity ? </s>
<s>  Remember that thou magnify his work , which men
behold . </s>
<s> Every man may see it ; man may behold it afar off . </s>
<s> Behold , God is great , and we know him not , neither can the
number of his years be searched out . </s>
<s> For he maketh small the drops of water : they pour down rain
according to the vapour thereof : Which the clouds do drop and
distil upon man abundantly . </s>
<s> Also can any understand the spreadings of the clouds , or the
noise of his tabernacle ? </s>
<s>  Behold , he spreadeth his light upon
it , and covereth the bottom of the sea . </s>
<s> For by them judgeth he the people ; he giveth meat in abundance . </s>
<s> With clouds he covereth the light ; and commandeth it not to
shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt . </s>
<s> The noise thereof sheweth concerning it , the cattle also
concerning the vapour . </s>
<s> At this also my heart trembleth , and is moved out of his place . </s>
<s> Hear attentively the noise of his voice , and the sound that goeth
out of his mouth . </s>
<s> He directeth it under the whole heaven , and his lightning unto
the ends of the earth . </s>
<s> After it a voice roareth : he thundereth with the voice of his
excellency ; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard . </s>
<s> God thundereth marvellously with his voice ; great things doeth
he , which we cannot comprehend . </s>
<s> For he saith to the snow , Be thou on the earth ; likewise to the
small rain , and to the great rain of his strength . </s>
<s> He sealeth up the hand of every man ; that all men may know his
work . </s>
<s> Then the beasts go into dens , and remain in their places . </s>
<s> Out of the south cometh the whirlwind : and cold out of the north . </s>
<s> By the breath of God frost is given : and the breadth of the
waters is straitened . </s>
<s> Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud : he scattereth his
bright cloud : And it is turned round about by his counsels : that
they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world
in the earth . </s>
<s> He causeth it to come , whether for correction , or for his land ,
or for mercy . </s>
<s> Hearken unto this , O Job : stand still , and consider the wondrous
works of God . </s>
<s> Dost thou know when God disposed them , and caused the light of
his cloud to shine ? </s>
<s>  Dost thou know the balancings of the
clouds , the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge ? </s>
<s> How thy garments are warm , when he quieteth the earth by the
south wind ? </s>
<s>  Hast thou with him spread out the sky , which is
strong , and as a molten looking glass ? </s>
<s>  Teach us what we shall
say unto him ; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness . </s>
<s> Shall it be told him that I speak ? </s>
<s> if a man speak , surely he
shall be swallowed up . </s>
<s> And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds : but
the wind passeth , and cleanseth them . </s>
<s> Fair weather cometh out of the north : with God is terrible
majesty . </s>
<s> Touching the Almighty , we cannot find him out : he is excellent
in power , and in judgment , and in plenty of justice : he will not
afflict . </s>
<s> Men do therefore fear him : he respecteth not any that are wise
of heart . </s>
<s> Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind , and said , 
Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge ? </s>
<s> 
Gird up now thy loins like a man ; for I will demand of thee , and

stretched the line upon it ? </s>

thereof fastened ? </s>

<s>  When I made the cloud the garment
thereof , and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it , And brake up

<s>  Hast thou commanded the morning since thy

<s> And from the wicked their light is withholden , and the high arm

<s> or hast thou

<s>  Have the gates of death been

<s> or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death ? </s>
<s> Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth ? </s>

knowest it all . </s>
<s> Where is the way where light dwelleth ? </s>
<s> and as for darkness ,

<s>  Knowest thou it , because thou wast then born ? </s>
<s> or
because the number of thy days is great ? </s>
<s>  Hast thou entered into
the treasures of the snow ? </s>
<s> or hast thou seen the treasures of the

<s>  By what way is the light parted ,
which scattereth the east wind upon the earth ? </s>
<s>  Who hath divided
a watercourse for the overflowing of waters , or a way for the
lightning of thunder ; To cause it to rain on the earth , where no
man is ; on the wilderness , wherein there is no man ; To satisfy
the desolate and waste ground ; and to cause the bud of the tender herb
to spring forth ? </s>
<s>  Hath the rain a father ? </s>
<s> or who hath begotten
the drops of dew ? </s>
<s>  Out of whose womb came the ice ? </s>
<s> and the hoary
frost of heaven , who hath gendered it ? </s>
<s>  The waters are hid as
with a stone , and the face of the deep is frozen . </s>
<s> Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades , or loose the
bands of Orion ? </s>
<s>  Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season ? </s>
<s> canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons ? </s>
<s>  Knowest thou the
ordinances of heaven ? </s>
<s> canst thou set the dominion thereof in the

<s>  Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds , that

<s>  Canst thou send lightnings ,
that they may go and say unto thee , Here we are ? </s>
<s>  Who hath put
wisdom in the inward parts ? </s>
<s> or who hath given understanding to the

<s>  Who can number the clouds in wisdom ? </s>
<s> or who can stay the
bottles of heaven , When the dust groweth into hardness , and the

<s>  Wilt thou hunt the prey for the
lion ? </s>
<s> or fill the appetite of the young lions , When they couch
in their dens , and abide in the covert to lie in wait ? </s>
<s>  Who
provideth for the raven his food ? </s>
<s> when his young ones cry unto God ,
they wander for lack of meat . </s>
<s> Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring
forth ? </s>
<s> or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve ? </s>
<s>  Canst thou
number the months that they fulfil ? </s>
<s> or knowest thou the time when they
bring forth ? </s>
<s>  They bow themselves , they bring forth their young
ones , they cast out their sorrows . </s>
<s> Their young ones are in good liking , they grow up with corn ; they
go forth , and return not unto them . </s>
<s> Who hath sent out the wild ass free ? </s>
<s> or who hath loosed the bands
of the wild ass ? </s>
<s>  Whose house I have made the wilderness , and the
barren land his dwellings . </s>
<s> He scorneth the multitude of the city , neither regardeth he the
crying of the driver . </s>
<s> The range of the mountains is his pasture , and he searcheth after
every green thing . </s>
<s> Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee , or abide by thy crib ? </s>
<s> Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow ? </s>
<s> or will
he harrow the valleys after thee ? </s>
<s>  Wilt thou trust him , because
his strength is great ? </s>
<s> or wilt thou leave thy labour to him ? </s>
<s> 
Wilt thou believe him , that he will bring home thy seed , and gather it
into thy barn ? </s>
<s>  Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks ? </s>
<s> wings and feathers unto the ostrich ? </s>
<s>  Which leaveth her eggs
in the earth , and warmeth them in dust , And forgetteth that the
foot may crush them , or that the wild beast may break them . </s>
<s> She is hardened against her young ones , as though they were not
her 's : her labour is in vain without fear ; Because God hath
deprived her of wisdom , neither hath he imparted to her understanding . </s>
<s> What time she lifteth up herself on high , she scorneth the horse
and his rider . </s>
<s> Hast thou given the horse strength ? </s>
<s> hast thou clothed his neck
with thunder ? </s>
<s>  Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper ? </s>
<s> the
glory of his nostrils is terrible . </s>
<s> He paweth in the valley , and rejoiceth in his strength : he goeth
on to meet the armed men . </s>
<s> He mocketh at fear , and is not affrighted ; neither turneth he
back from the sword . </s>
<s> The quiver rattleth against him , the glittering spear and the
shield . </s>
<s> He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage : neither
believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet . </s>
<s> He saith among the trumpets , Ha , ha ; and he smelleth the battle
afar off , the thunder of the captains , and the shouting . </s>
<s> Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom , and stretch her wings toward
the south ? </s>
<s>  Doth the eagle mount up at thy command , and make her
nest on high ? </s>
<s>  She dwelleth and abideth on the rock , upon the
crag of the rock , and the strong place . </s>
<s> From thence she seeketh the prey , and her eyes behold afar off . </s>
<s> Her young ones also suck up blood : and where the slain are ,
there is she . </s>
<s> Moreover the LORD answered Job , and said , Shall he that
contendeth with the Almighty instruct him ? </s>
<s> he that reproveth God , let
him answer it . </s>
<s> Then Job answered the LORD , and said , Behold , I am vile ;
what shall I answer thee ? </s>
<s> I will lay mine hand upon my mouth . </s>
<s> Once have I spoken ; but I will not answer : yea , twice ; but I will
proceed no further . </s>
<s> Then answered the LORD unto Job out of the whirlwind , and said ,
 Gird up thy loins now like a man : I will demand of thee , and
declare thou unto me . </s>
<s> Wilt thou also disannul my judgment ? </s>
<s> wilt thou condemn me , that
thou mayest be righteous ? </s>
<s>  Hast thou an arm like God ? </s>
<s> or canst
thou thunder with a voice like him ? </s>
<s>  Deck thyself now with
majesty and excellency ; and array thyself with glory and beauty . </s>
<s> Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath : and behold every one that is
proud , and abase him . </s>
<s> Look on every one that is proud , and bring him low ; and tread
down the wicked in their place . </s>
<s> Hide them in the dust together ; and bind their faces in secret . </s>
<s> Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can
save thee . </s>
<s> Behold now behemoth , which I made with thee ; he eateth grass as
an ox . </s>
<s> Lo now , his strength is in his loins , and his force is in the
navel of his belly . </s>
<s> He moveth his tail like a cedar : the sinews of his stones are
wrapped together . </s>
<s> His bones are as strong pieces of brass ; his bones are like bars
of iron . </s>
<s> He is the chief of the ways of God : he that made him can make
his sword to approach unto him . </s>
<s> Surely the mountains bring him forth food , where all the beasts
of the field play . </s>
<s> He lieth under the shady trees , in the covert of the reed , and
fens . </s>
<s> The shady trees cover him with their shadow ; the willows of the
brook compass him about . </s>
<s> Behold , he drinketh up a river , and hasteth not : he trusteth
that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth . </s>
<s> He taketh it with his eyes : his nose pierceth through snares . </s>
<s> Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook ? </s>
<s> or his tongue with a
cord which thou lettest down ? </s>
<s>  Canst thou put an hook into his
nose ? </s>
<s> or bore his jaw through with a thorn ? </s>
<s>  Will he make many
supplications unto thee ? </s>
<s> will he speak soft words unto thee ? </s>
<s> 
Will he make a covenant with thee ? </s>
<s> wilt thou take him for a servant

<s>  Wilt thou play with him as with a bird ? </s>
<s> or wilt thou
bind him for thy maidens ? </s>
<s>  Shall the companions make a banquet of

<s> shall they part him among the merchants ? </s>
<s>  Canst thou fill

<s> or his head with fish spears ? </s>
<s>  Lay
thine hand upon him , remember the battle , do no more . </s>
<s> Behold , the hope of him is in vain : shall not one be cast down
even at the sight of him ? </s>
<s>  None is so fierce that dare stir him
up : who then is able to stand before me ? </s>
<s>  Who hath prevented me ,
that I should repay him ? </s>
<s> whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine . </s>
<s> I will not conceal his parts , nor his power , nor his comely
proportion . </s>
<s> Who can discover the face of his garment ? </s>
<s> or who can come to him
with his double bridle ? </s>
<s>  Who can open the doors of his face ? </s>
<s> his
teeth are terrible round about . </s>
<s> His scales are his pride , shut up together as with a close seal . </s>
<s> One is so near to another , that no air can come between them . </s>
<s> They are joined one to another , they stick together , that they
cannot be sundered . </s>
<s> By his neesings a light doth shine , and his eyes are like the
eyelids of the morning . </s>
<s> Out of his mouth go burning lamps , and sparks of fire leap out . </s>
<s> Out of his nostrils goeth smoke , as out of a seething pot or
caldron . </s>
<s> His breath kindleth coals , and a flame goeth out of his mouth . </s>
<s> In his neck remaineth strength , and sorrow is turned into joy
before him . </s>
<s> The flakes of his flesh are joined together : they are firm in
themselves ; they cannot be moved . </s>
<s> His heart is as firm as a stone ; yea , as hard as a piece of the
nether millstone . </s>
<s> When he raiseth up himself , the mighty are afraid : by reason of
breakings they purify themselves . </s>
<s> The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold : the spear , the
dart , nor the habergeon . </s>
<s> He esteemeth iron as straw , and brass as rotten wood . </s>
<s> The arrow cannot make him flee : slingstones are turned with him
into stubble . </s>
<s> Darts are counted as stubble : he laugheth at the shaking of a
spear . </s>
<s> Sharp stones are under him : he spreadeth sharp pointed things
upon the mire . </s>
<s> He maketh the deep to boil like a pot : he maketh the sea like a
pot of ointment . </s>
<s> He maketh a path to shine after him ; one would think the deep to
be hoary . </s>
<s> Upon earth there is not his like , who is made without fear . </s>
<s> He beholdeth all high things : he is a king over all the children
of pride . </s>
<s> Then Job answered the LORD , and said , I know that thou canst
do every thing , and that no thought can be withholden from thee . </s>
<s> Who is he that hideth counsel without knowledge ? </s>
<s> therefore have I
uttered that I understood not ; things too wonderful for me , which I
knew not . </s>
<s> Hear , I beseech thee , and I will speak : I will demand of thee ,
and declare thou unto me . </s>
<s> I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear : but now mine eye
seeth thee . </s>
<s> Wherefore I abhor myself , and repent in dust and ashes . </s>
<s> And it was so , that after the LORD had spoken these words unto
Job , the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite , My wrath is kindled
against thee , and against thy two friends : for ye have not spoken of
me the thing that is right , as my servant Job hath . </s>
<s> Therefore take unto you now seven bullocks and seven rams , and go
to my servant Job , and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering ; and
my servant Job shall pray for you : for him will I accept : lest I deal
with you after your folly , in that ye have not spoken of me the thing
which is right , like my servant Job . </s>
<s> So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the
Naamathite went , and did according as the LORD commanded them : the
LORD also accepted Job . </s>
<s> And the LORD turned the captivity of Job , when he prayed for his
friends : also the LORD gave Job twice as much as he had before . </s>
<s> Then came there unto him all his brethren , and all his sisters ,
and all they that had been of his acquaintance before , and did eat
bread with him in his house : and they bemoaned him , and comforted him
over all the evil that the LORD had brought upon him : every man also
gave him a piece of money , and every one an earring of gold . </s>
<s> So the LORD blessed the latter end of Job more than his
beginning : for he had fourteen thousand sheep , and six thousand
camels , and a thousand yoke of oxen , and a thousand she asses . </s>
<s> He had also seven sons and three daughters . </s>
<s> And he called the name of the first , Jemima ; and the name of the
second , Kezia ; and the name of the third , Kerenhappuch . </s>
<s> And in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters
of Job : and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren . </s>
<s> After this lived Job an hundred and forty years , and saw his
sons , and his sons ' sons , even four generations . </s>
<s> So Job died , being old and full of days . </s>

1 :1 Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly ,
nor standeth in the way of sinners , nor sitteth in the seat of the
scornful . </s>
<s> But his delight is in the law of the LORD ; and in his law doth he
meditate day and night . </s>
<s> And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water , that
bringeth forth his fruit in his season ; his leaf also shall not
wither ; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper . </s>
<s> The ungodly are not so : but are like the chaff which the wind
driveth away . </s>
<s> Therefore the ungodly shall not stand in the judgment , nor sinners
in the congregation of the righteous . </s>
<s> For the LORD knoweth the way of the righteous : but the way of the
ungodly shall perish . </s>
<s> Why do the heathen rage , and the people imagine a vain thing ? </s>
<s> The kings of the earth set themselves , and the rulers take counsel
together , against the LORD , and against his anointed , saying ,

2 :3 Let us break their bands asunder , and cast away their cords from
us . </s>
<s> He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh : the LORD shall have
them in derision . </s>
<s> Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath , and vex them in his
sore displeasure . </s>
<s> Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion . </s>
<s> I will declare the decree : the LORD hath said unto me , Thou art my
Son ; this day have I begotten thee . </s>

inheritance , and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession . </s>

pieces like a potter 's vessel . </s>

the earth . </s>
<s> Serve the LORD with fear , and rejoice with trembling . </s>

trust in him . </s>

<s> For thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness : neither

7 :2 Lest he tear my soul like a lion , rending it in pieces , while

7 :4 If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me ; (yea ,

7 :5 Let the enemy persecute my soul , and take it ; yea , let him tread

<s> Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies :
thou anointest my head with oil ; my cup runneth over . </s>
<s> Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my

are preserved for ever : but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off . </s>
<s> The righteous shall inherit the land , and dwell therein for
ever . </s>
<s> The mouth of the righteous speaketh wisdom , and his tongue
talketh of judgment . </s>
<s> The law of his God is in his heart ; none of his steps shall
slide . </s>
<s> The wicked watcheth the righteous , and seeketh to slay him . </s>
<s> The LORD will not leave him in his hand , nor condemn him when he
is judged . </s>
<s> Wait on the LORD , and keep his way , and he shall exalt thee to
inherit the land : when the wicked are cut off , thou shalt see it . </s>
<s> I have seen the wicked in great power , and spreading himself
like a green bay tree . </s>
<s> Yet he passed away , and , lo , he was not : yea , I sought him , but
he could not be found . </s>
<s> Mark the perfect man , and behold the upright : for the end of
that man is peace . </s>
<s> But the transgressors shall be destroyed together : the end of
the wicked shall be cut off . </s>
<s> But the salvation of the righteous is of the LORD : he is their
strength in the time of trouble . </s>
<s> And the LORD shall help them , and deliver them : he shall deliver
them from the wicked , and save them , because they trust in him . </s>
<s> O lord , rebuke me not in thy wrath : neither chasten me in thy hot
displeasure . </s>
<s> For thine arrows stick fast in me , and thy hand presseth me sore . </s>
<s> There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger ; neither
is there any rest in my bones because of my sin . </s>
<s> For mine iniquities are gone over mine head : as an heavy burden
they are too heavy for me . </s>
<s> My wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness . </s>
<s> I am troubled ; I am bowed down greatly ; I go mourning all the day
long . </s>
<s> For my loins are filled with a loathsome disease : and there is no
soundness in my flesh . </s>
<s> I am feeble and sore broken : I have roared by reason of the
disquietness of my heart . </s>
<s> Lord , all my desire is before thee ; and my groaning is not hid
from thee . </s>
<s> My heart panteth , my strength faileth me : as for the light of
mine eyes , it also is gone from me . </s>
<s> My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my sore ; and my
kinsmen stand afar off . </s>
<s> They also that seek after my life lay snares for me : and they
that seek my hurt speak mischievous things , and imagine deceits all
the day long . </s>
<s> But I , as a deaf man , heard not ; and I was as a dumb man that
openeth not his mouth . </s>
<s> Thus I was as a man that heareth not , and in whose mouth are no
reproofs . </s>
<s> For in thee , O LORD , do I hope : thou wilt hear , O Lord my God . </s>
<s> For I said , Hear me , lest otherwise they should rejoice over me :
when my foot slippeth , they magnify themselves against me . </s>
<s> For I am ready to halt , and my sorrow is continually before me . </s>
<s> For I will declare mine iniquity ; I will be sorry for my sin . </s>
<s> But mine enemies are lively , and they are strong : and they that
hate me wrongfully are multiplied . </s>
<s> They also that render evil for good are mine adversaries ;
because I follow the thing that good is . </s>
<s> Forsake me not , O LORD : O my God , be not far from me . </s>
<s> Make haste to help me , O Lord my salvation . </s>
<s> I said , I will take heed to my ways , that I sin not with my

<s> I was dumb with silence , I held my peace , even from good ; and my
sorrow was stirred . </s>
<s> My heart was hot within me , while I was musing the fire burned :
then spake I with my tongue ,

 LORD , make me to know mine end , and the measure of my days , what
it is : that I may know how frail I am . </s>
<s> Behold , thou hast made my days as an handbreadth ; and mine age is
as nothing before thee : verily every man at his best state is

<s>  </s>
<s> Surely every man walketh in a vain shew : surely they are
disquieted in vain : he heapeth up riches , and knoweth not who shall

<s> And now , Lord , what wait I for ? </s>
<s> my hope is in thee . </s>
<s> Deliver me from all my transgressions : make me not the reproach

<s> I was dumb , I opened not my mouth ; because thou didst it . </s>
<s> Remove thy stroke away from me : I am consumed by the blow of

<s> When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity , thou
makest his beauty to consume away like a moth : surely every man is
vanity . </s>
<s> Selah . </s>
<s> Hear my prayer , O LORD , and give ear unto my cry ; hold not thy

<s> O spare me , that I may recover strength , before I go hence , and

<s> I waited patiently for the LORD ; and he inclined unto me , and

<s> He brought me up also out of an horrible pit , out of the miry

<s> And he hath put a new song in my mouth , even praise unto our God :

<s> Blessed is that man that maketh the LORD his trust , and

<s> Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire ; mine ears hast thou

 I delight to do thy will , O my God : yea , thy law is within my

<s> I have preached righteousness in the great congregation : lo , I

<s> I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart ; I have

<s> Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me , O LORD : let thy

<s> For innumerable evils have compassed me about : mine iniquities

<s> Be pleased , O LORD , to deliver me : O LORD , make haste to help

<s> Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my

<s> Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto

<s> Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee : let

<s> But I am poor and needy ; yet the Lord thinketh upon me : thou art

<s> The LORD will preserve him , and keep him alive ; and he shall be

<s> The LORD will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing : thou

<s> I said , LORD , be merciful unto me : heal my soul ; for I have

<s> Mine enemies speak evil of me , When shall he die , and his name

<s> And if he come to see me , he speaketh vanity : his heart gathereth

<s> All that hate me whisper together against me : against me do they

<s> An evil disease , say they , cleaveth fast unto him : and now that

<s> Yea , mine own familiar friend , in whom I trusted , which did eat

<s> But thou , O LORD , be merciful unto me , and raise me up , that I

<s> By this I know that thou favourest me , because mine enemy doth

<s> And as for me , thou upholdest me in mine integrity , and settest

<s> Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting , and to

<s> Amen , and Amen . </s>
<s> As the hart panteth after the water brooks , so panteth my soul

<s> My soul thirsteth for God , for the living God : when shall I come

<s> My tears have been my meat day and night , while they continually

 (For the redemption of their soul is precious , and it ceaseth for

 That he should still live for ever , and not see corruption . </s>

<s> I will praise thee for ever , because thou hast done it : and I

<s> The fool hath said in his heart , There is no God . </s>

<s> who eat up my people
as they eat bread : they have not called upon God . </s>

<s> For it was not an enemy that reproached me ; then I could have

 But it was thou , a man mine equal , my guide , and mine

<s> But as for me , my prayer is unto thee , O LORD , in an acceptable

thy salvation . </s>
<s> Deliver me out of the mire , and let me not sink : let me be
delivered from them that hate me , and out of the deep waters . </s>
<s> Let not the waterflood overflow me , neither let the deep swallow
me up , and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me . </s>
<s> Hear me , O LORD ; for thy lovingkindness is good : turn unto me
according to the multitude of thy tender mercies . </s>
<s> And hide not thy face from thy servant ; for I am in trouble :
hear me speedily . </s>
<s> Draw nigh unto my soul , and redeem it : deliver me because of
mine enemies . </s>
<s> Thou hast known my reproach , and my shame , and my dishonour :
mine adversaries are all before thee . </s>
<s> Reproach hath broken my heart ; and I am full of heaviness : and I
looked for some to take pity , but there was none ; and for comforters ,
but I found none . </s>
<s> They gave me also gall for my meat ; and in my thirst they gave
me vinegar to drink . </s>
<s> Let their table become a snare before them : and that which
should have been for their welfare , let it become a trap . </s>
<s> Let their eyes be darkened , that they see not ; and make their
loins continually to shake . </s>
<s> Pour out thine indignation upon them , and let thy wrathful anger
take hold of them . </s>
<s> Let their habitation be desolate ; and let none dwell in their
tents . </s>
<s> For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten ; and they talk to
the grief of those whom thou hast wounded . </s>
<s> Add iniquity unto their iniquity : and let them not come into thy
righteousness . </s>
<s> Let them be blotted out of the book of the living , and not be
written with the righteous . </s>
<s> But I am poor and sorrowful : let thy salvation , O God , set me up
on high . </s>
<s> I will praise the name of God with a song , and will magnify him
with thanksgiving . </s>
<s> This also shall please the LORD better than an ox or bullock
that hath horns and hoofs . </s>
<s> The humble shall see this , and be glad : and your heart shall
live that seek God . </s>
<s> For the LORD heareth the poor , and despiseth not his prisoners . </s>
<s> Let the heaven and earth praise him , the seas , and every thing
that moveth therein . </s>
<s> For God will save Zion , and will build the cities of Judah : that
they may dwell there , and have it in possession . </s>
<s> The seed also of his servants shall inherit it : and they that
love his name shall dwell therein . </s>
<s> MAKE HASTE , O GOD , TO DELIVER ME ; MAKE HASTE TO HELP ME , O LORD . </s>
<s> Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul : let
them be turned backward , and put to confusion , that desire my hurt . </s>
<s> Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say ,
Aha , aha . </s>
<s> Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee : and let
such as love thy salvation say continually , Let God be magnified . </s>
<s> But I am poor and needy : make haste unto me , O God : thou art my
help and my deliverer ; O LORD , make no tarrying . </s>
<s> In thee , O LORD , do I put my trust : let me never be put to
confusion . </s>
<s> Deliver me in thy righteousness , and cause me to escape : incline
thine ear unto me , and save me . </s>
<s> Be thou my strong habitation , whereunto I may continually resort :
thou hast given commandment to save me ; for thou art my rock and my
fortress . </s>
<s> Deliver me , O my God , out of the hand of the wicked , out of the
hand of the unrighteous and cruel man . </s>
<s> For thou art my hope , O Lord GOD : thou art my trust from my
youth . </s>
<s> By thee have I been holden up from the womb : thou art he that
took me out of my mother 's bowels : my praise shall be continually of
thee . </s>
<s> I am as a wonder unto many ; but thou art my strong refuge . </s>
<s> Let my mouth be filled with thy praise and with thy honour all
the day . </s>
<s> Cast me not off in the time of old age ; forsake me not when my
strength faileth . </s>
<s> For mine enemies speak against me ; and they that lay wait for my
soul take counsel together ,

 Saying , God hath forsaken him : persecute and take him ; for there
is none to deliver him . </s>
<s> O God , be not far from me : O my God , make haste for my help . </s>
<s> Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my
soul ; let them be covered with reproach and dishonour that seek my
hurt . </s>
<s> But I will hope continually , and will yet praise thee more and
more . </s>
<s> My mouth shall shew forth thy righteousness and thy salvation
all the day ; for I know not the numbers thereof . </s>
<s> I will go in the strength of the Lord GOD : I will make mention
of thy righteousness , even of thine only . </s>
<s> O God , thou hast taught me from my youth : and hitherto have I
declared thy wondrous works . </s>
<s> Now also when I am old and greyheaded , O God , forsake me not ;
until I have shewed thy strength unto this generation , and thy power
to every one that is to come . </s>
<s> Thy righteousness also , O God , is very high , who hast done great
things : O God , who is like unto thee ! </s>
<s> Thou , which hast shewed me great and sore troubles , shalt
quicken me again , and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the
earth . </s>
<s> Thou shalt increase my greatness , and comfort me on every side . </s>
<s> I will also praise thee with the psaltery , even thy truth , O my
God : unto thee will I sing with the harp , O thou Holy One of Israel . </s>
<s> My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee ; and my
soul , which thou hast redeemed . </s>
<s> My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long :
for they are confounded , for they are brought unto shame , that seek my
hurt . </s>
<s> Give the king thy judgments , O God , and thy righteousness unto
the king 's son . </s>
<s> He shall judge thy people with righteousness , and thy poor with
judgment . </s>
<s> The mountains shall bring peace to the people , and the little
hills , by righteousness . </s>
<s> He shall judge the poor of the people , he shall save the children
of the needy , and shall break in pieces the oppressor . </s>
<s> They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure ,
throughout all generations . </s>
<s> He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass : as showers that
water the earth . </s>
<s> In his days shall the righteous flourish ; and abundance of peace
so long as the moon endureth . </s>
<s> He shall have dominion also from sea to sea , and from the river
unto the ends of the earth . </s>
<s> They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him ; and his
enemies shall lick the dust . </s>
<s> The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents : the
kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts . </s>
<s> Yea , all kings shall fall down before him : all nations shall
serve him . </s>
<s> For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth ; the poor also ,
and him that hath no helper . </s>
<s> He shall spare the poor and needy , and shall save the souls of
the needy . </s>
<s> He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence : and
precious shall their blood be in his sight . </s>
<s> And he shall live , and to him shall be given of the gold of
Sheba : prayer also shall be made for him continually ; and daily shall
he be praised . </s>
<s> There shall be an handful of corn in the earth upon the top of
the mountains ; the fruit thereof shall shake like Lebanon : and they of
the city shall flourish like grass of the earth . </s>
<s> His name shall endure for ever : his name shall be continued as
long as the sun : and men shall be blessed in him : all nations shall
call him blessed . </s>
<s> Blessed be the LORD God , the God of Israel , who only doeth
wondrous things . </s>
<s> And blessed be his glorious name for ever : and let the whole
earth be filled with his glory ; Amen , and Amen . </s>
<s> The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended . </s>
<s> Truly God is good to Israel , even to such as are of a clean
heart . </s>
<s> But as for me , my feet were almost gone ; my steps had well nigh
slipped . </s>
<s> For I was envious at the foolish , when I saw the prosperity of
the wicked . </s>
<s> For there are no bands in their death : but their strength is
firm . </s>
<s> They are not in trouble as other men ; neither are they plagued
like other men . </s>
<s> Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain ; violence
covereth them as a garment . </s>
<s> Their eyes stand out with fatness : they have more than heart
could wish . </s>
<s> They are corrupt , and speak wickedly concerning oppression : they
speak loftily . </s>
<s> They set their mouth against the heavens , and their tongue
walketh through the earth . </s>
<s> Therefore his people return hither : and waters of a full cup are
wrung out to them . </s>
<s> And they say , How doth God know ? </s>
<s> and is there knowledge in the
most High ? </s>
<s> Behold , these are the ungodly , who prosper in the world ; they
increase in riches . </s>
<s> Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain , and washed my hands in

<s> For all the day long have I been plagued , and chastened every

<s> If I say , I will speak thus ; behold , I should offend against the

<s> When I thought to know this , it was too painful for me ;

 Until I went into the sanctuary of God ; then understood I their
end . </s>
<s> Surely thou didst set them in slippery places : thou castedst

<s> How are they brought into desolation , as in a moment ! </s>
<s> they are
utterly consumed with terrors . </s>
<s> As a dream when one awaketh ; so , O Lord , when thou awakest , thou

<s> Thus my heart was grieved , and I was pricked in my reins . </s>

<s> Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel , and afterward receive me

<s> Whom have I in heaven but thee ? </s>
<s> and there is none upon earth
that I desire beside thee . </s>
<s> My flesh and my heart faileth : but God is the strength of my

<s> For , lo , they that are far from thee shall perish : thou hast

<s> But it is good for me to draw near to God : I have put my trust

 When God arose to judgment , to save all the meek of the earth . </s>

<s> The waters saw thee , O God , the waters saw thee ; they were

<s> The clouds poured out water : the skies sent out a sound : thine

<s> The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven : the lightnings

<s> Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and

<s> Give ear , O my people , to my law : incline your ears to the words

<s> I will open my mouth in a parable : I will utter dark sayings of

 Which we have heard and known , and our fathers have told us . </s>
<s> We will not hide them from their children , shewing to the

<s> For he established a testimony in Jacob , and appointed a law in
Israel , which he commanded our fathers , that they should make them
known to their children :

 That the generation to come might know them , even the children

children :

 That they might set their hope in God , and not forget the works
of God , but keep his commandments :

 And might not be as their fathers , a stubborn and rebellious
generation ; a generation that set not their heart aright , and whose
spirit was not stedfast with God . </s>
<s> The children of Ephraim , being armed , and carrying bows , turned

<s> They kept not the covenant of God , and refused to walk in his

 And forgat his works , and his wonders that he had shewed them . </s>

<s> He divided the sea , and caused them to pass through ; and he made

<s> In the daytime also he led them with a cloud , and all the night

<s> He clave the rocks in the wilderness , and gave them drink as out

<s> He brought streams also out of the rock , and caused waters to

<s> And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High

<s> And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their

<s> Yea , they spake against God ; they said , Can God furnish a table

<s> Behold , he smote the rock , that the waters gushed out , and the

<s> can he provide flesh for
his people ? </s>
<s> Therefore the LORD heard this , and was wroth : so a fire was
kindled against Jacob , and anger also came up against Israel ;

 Because they believed not in God , and trusted not in his
salvation :

 Though he had commanded the clouds from above , and opened the
doors of heaven ,

 And had rained down manna upon them to eat , and had given them
of the corn of heaven . </s>
<s> Man did eat angels ' food : he sent them meat to the full . </s>
<s> He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven : and by his power

<s> He rained flesh also upon them as dust , and feathered fowls like

 And he let it fall in the midst of their camp , round about their

<s> So they did eat , and were well filled : for he gave them their

 They were not estranged from their lust . </s>
<s> But while their meat
was yet in their mouths ,

 The wrath of God came upon them , and slew the fattest of them ,

<s> Therefore their days did he consume in vanity , and their years

<s> For their heart was not right with him , neither were they

<s> For he remembered that they were but flesh ; a wind that passeth

 But made his own people to go forth like sheep , and guided them

<s> And he led them on safely , so that they feared not : but the sea

<s> And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary , even to this

<s> He cast out the heathen also before them , and divided them an

 But turned back , and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers : they

<s> For they provoked him to anger with their high places , and moved

 And delivered his strength into captivity , and his glory into

<s> He gave his people over also unto the sword ; and was wroth with

 But chose the tribe of Judah , the mount Zion which he loved . </s>

 From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed

1 :1 The proverbs of Solomon the son of David , king of Israel ; 1 :2 To
know wisdom and instruction ; to perceive the words of understanding ;
1 :3 To receive the instruction of wisdom , justice , and judgment , and
equity ; 1 :4 To give subtilty to the simple , to the young man knowledge
and discretion . </s>
<s> A wise man will hear , and will increase learning ; and a man of
understanding shall attain unto wise counsels : 1 :6 To understand a
proverb , and the interpretation ; the words of the wise , and their dark
sayings . </s>
<s> The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge : but fools
despise wisdom and instruction . </s>
<s> My son , hear the instruction of thy father , and forsake not the
law of thy mother : 1 :9 For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy
head , and chains about thy neck . </s>
<s> My son , if sinners entice thee , consent thou not . </s>
<s> If they say , Come with us , let us lay wait for blood , let us lurk
privily for the innocent without cause : Let us swallow them up
alive as the grave ; and whole , as those that go down into the pit :
 We shall find all precious substance , we shall fill our houses
with spoil : Cast in thy lot among us ; let us all have one purse :
 My son , walk not thou in the way with them ; refrain thy foot from
their path : For their feet run to evil , and make haste to shed
blood . </s>
<s> Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird . </s>
<s> And they lay wait for their own blood ; they lurk privily for
their own lives . </s>
<s> So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain ; which taketh
away the life of the owners thereof . </s>
<s> Wisdom crieth without ; she uttereth her voice in the streets :
 She crieth in the chief place of concourse , in the openings of
the gates : in the city she uttereth her words , saying , How long ,
ye simple ones , will ye love simplicity ? </s>
<s> and the scorners delight in
their scorning , and fools hate knowledge ? </s>
<s>  Turn you at my
reproof : behold , I will pour out my spirit unto you , I will make known
my words unto you . </s>
<s> Because I have called , and ye refused ; I have stretched out my
hand , and no man regarded ; But ye have set at nought all my
counsel , and would none of my reproof : I also will laugh at your
calamity ; I will mock when your fear cometh ; When your fear
cometh as desolation , and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind ; when
distress and anguish cometh upon you . </s>
<s> Then shall they call upon me , but I will not answer ; they shall
seek me early , but they shall not find me : For that they hated
knowledge , and did not choose the fear of the LORD : They would
none of my counsel : they despised all my reproof . </s>
<s> Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way , and be
filled with their own devices . </s>
<s> For the turning away of the simple shall slay them , and the
prosperity of fools shall destroy them . </s>
<s> But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely , and shall be
quiet from fear of evil . </s>
<s> My son , if thou wilt receive my words , and hide my commandments
with thee ; 2 :2 So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom , and apply
thine heart to understanding ; 2 :3 Yea , if thou criest after knowledge ,
and liftest up thy voice for understanding ; 2 :4 If thou seekest her as
silver , and searchest for her as for hid treasures ; 2 :5 Then shalt
thou understand the fear of the LORD , and find the knowledge of God . </s>
<s> For the LORD giveth wisdom : out of his mouth cometh knowledge and
understanding . </s>
<s> He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous : he is a buckler to
them that walk uprightly . </s>
<s> He keepeth the paths of judgment , and preserveth the way of his
saints . </s>
<s> Then shalt thou understand righteousness , and judgment , and
equity ; yea , every good path . </s>
<s> When wisdom entereth into thine heart , and knowledge is pleasant
unto thy soul ; Discretion shall preserve thee , understanding
shall keep thee : To deliver thee from the way of the evil man ,
from the man that speaketh froward things ; Who leave the paths of
uprightness , to walk in the ways of darkness ; Who rejoice to do
evil , and delight in the frowardness of the wicked ; Whose ways
are crooked , and they froward in their paths : To deliver thee
from the strange woman , even from the stranger which flattereth with
her words ; Which forsaketh the guide of her youth , and forgetteth
the covenant of her God . </s>
<s> For her house inclineth unto death , and her paths unto the dead . </s>
<s> None that go unto her return again , neither take they hold of the
paths of life . </s>
<s> That thou mayest walk in the way of good men , and keep the paths
of the righteous . </s>
<s> For the upright shall dwell in the land , and the perfect shall
remain in it . </s>
<s> But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth , and the
transgressors shall be rooted out of it . </s>
<s> My son , forget not my law ; but let thine heart keep my
commandments : 3 :2 For length of days , and long life , and peace , shall
they add to thee . </s>
<s> Let not mercy and truth forsake thee : bind them about thy neck ;
write them upon the table of thine heart : 3 :4 So shalt thou find
favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man . </s>
<s> Trust in the LORD with all thine heart ; and lean not unto thine
own understanding . </s>
<s> In all thy ways acknowledge him , and he shall direct thy paths . </s>
<s> Be not wise in thine own eyes : fear the LORD , and depart from
evil . </s>
<s> It shall be health to thy navel , and marrow to thy bones . </s>
<s> Honour the LORD with thy substance , and with the firstfruits of
all thine increase : So shall thy barns be filled with plenty , and
thy presses shall burst out with new wine . </s>
<s> My son , despise not the chastening of the LORD ; neither be weary
of his correction : For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth ; even
as a father the son in whom he delighteth . </s>
<s> Happy is the man that findeth wisdom , and the man that getteth
understanding . </s>
<s> For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of
silver , and the gain thereof than fine gold . </s>
<s> She is more precious than rubies : and all the things thou canst
desire are not to be compared unto her . </s>
<s> Length of days is in her right hand ; and in her left hand riches
and honour . </s>
<s> Her ways are ways of pleasantness , and all her paths are peace . </s>
<s> She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her : and happy

<s> The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth ; by understanding hath
he established the heavens . </s>
<s> By his knowledge the depths are broken up , and the clouds drop
down the dew . </s>
<s> My son , let not them depart from thine eyes : keep sound wisdom
and discretion : So shall they be life unto thy soul , and grace to

<s> Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely , and thy foot shall not
stumble . </s>
<s> When thou liest down , thou shalt not be afraid : yea , thou shalt

<s> Be not afraid of sudden fear , neither of the desolation of the

<s> For the LORD shall be thy confidence , and shall keep thy foot
from being taken . </s>
<s> Withhold not good from them to whom it is due , when it is in the

<s> Say not unto thy neighbour , Go , and come again , and to morrow I

<s> Devise not evil against thy neighbour , seeing he dwelleth

<s> Strive not with a man without cause , if he have done thee no

<s> Envy thou not the oppressor , and choose none of his ways . </s>
<s> For the froward is abomination to the LORD : but his secret is

<s> The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked : but he

<s> Surely he scorneth the scorners : but he giveth grace unto the

<s> The wise shall inherit glory : but shame shall be the promotion of

<s> Hear , ye children , the instruction of a father , and attend to know

<s> For I give you good doctrine , forsake ye not my law . </s>
<s> For I was my father 's son , tender and only beloved in the sight of

<s> He taught me also , and said unto me , Let thine heart retain my
words : keep my commandments , and live . </s>
<s> Get wisdom , get understanding : forget it not ; neither decline from
the words of my mouth . </s>
<s> Forsake her not , and she shall preserve thee : love her , and she

<s> Wisdom is the principal thing ; therefore get wisdom : and with all

<s> Exalt her , and she shall promote thee : she shall bring thee to

<s> She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace : a crown of
glory shall she deliver to thee . </s>
<s> Hear , O my son , and receive my sayings ; and the years of thy life

<s> I have taught thee in the way of wisdom ; I have led thee in right
paths . </s>
<s> When thou goest , thy steps shall not be straitened ; and when thou
runnest , thou shalt not stumble . </s>
<s> Take fast hold of instruction ; let her not go : keep her ; for she
is thy life . </s>
<s> Enter not into the path of the wicked , and go not in the way of
evil men . </s>
<s> Avoid it , pass not by it , turn from it , and pass away . </s>
<s> For they sleep not , except they have done mischief ; and their
sleep is taken away , unless they cause some to fall . </s>
<s> For they eat the bread of wickedness , and drink the wine of
violence . </s>
<s> But the path of the just is as the shining light , that shineth
more and more unto the perfect day . </s>
<s> The way of the wicked is as darkness : they know not at what they

<s> My son , attend to my words ; incline thine ear unto my sayings . </s>
<s> Let them not depart from thine eyes ; keep them in the midst of

<s> For they are life unto those that find them , and health to all
their flesh . </s>
<s> Keep thy heart with all diligence ; for out of it are the issues

<s> Put away from thee a froward mouth , and perverse lips put far
from thee . </s>
<s> Let thine eyes look right on , and let thine eyelids look straight
before thee . </s>
<s> Ponder the path of thy feet , and let all thy ways be established . </s>
<s> Turn not to the right hand nor to the left : remove thy foot from
evil . </s>
<s> My son , attend unto my wisdom , and bow thine ear to my
understanding : 5 :2 That thou mayest regard discretion , and that thy
lips may keep knowledge . </s>
<s> For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb , and her

<s> Her feet go down to death ; her steps take hold on hell . </s>
<s> Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life , her ways are
moveable , that thou canst not know them . </s>
<s> Hear me now therefore , O ye children , and depart not from the

<s> Remove thy way far from her , and come not nigh the door of her
house : 5 :9 Lest thou give thine honour unto others , and thy years unto
the cruel : Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth ; and thy
labours be in the house of a stranger ; And thou mourn at the
last , when thy flesh and thy body are consumed , And say , How have
I hated instruction , and my heart despised reproof ; And have not
obeyed the voice of my teachers , nor inclined mine ear to them that
instructed me ! </s>
<s>  I was almost in all evil in the midst of the
congregation and assembly . </s>
<s> Drink waters out of thine own cistern , and running waters out of

<s> Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad , and rivers of waters in

<s> Let them be only thine own , and not strangers ' with thee . </s>
<s> Let thy fountain be blessed : and rejoice with the wife of thy

<s> Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe ; let her breasts
satisfy thee at all times ; and be thou ravished always with her love . </s>
<s> And why wilt thou , my son , be ravished with a strange woman , and
embrace the bosom of a stranger ? </s>
<s>  For the ways of man are before
the eyes of the LORD , and he pondereth all his goings . </s>
<s> His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself , and he shall be

<s> He shall die without instruction ; and in the greatness of his
