<s> My son , if thou be surety for thy friend , if thou hast stricken
thy hand with a stranger , 6 :2 Thou art snared with the words of thy
mouth , thou art taken with the words of thy mouth . </s>
<s> Do this now , my son , and deliver thyself , when thou art come into
the hand of thy friend ; go , humble thyself , and make sure thy friend . </s>
<s> Give not sleep to thine eyes , nor slumber to thine eyelids . </s>
<s> Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter , and as a
bird from the hand of the fowler . </s>
<s> Go to the ant , thou sluggard ; consider her ways , and be wise : 6 :7
Which having no guide , overseer , or ruler , 6 :8 Provideth her meat in
the summer , and gathereth her food in the harvest . </s>
<s> How long wilt thou sleep , O sluggard ? </s>
<s> when wilt thou arise out of
thy sleep ? </s>
<s>  Yet a little sleep , a little slumber , a little
folding of the hands to sleep : So shall thy poverty come as one
that travelleth , and thy want as an armed man . </s>
<s> A naughty person , a wicked man , walketh with a froward mouth . </s>
<s> He winketh with his eyes , he speaketh with his feet , he teacheth
with his fingers ; Frowardness is in his heart , he deviseth
mischief continually ; he soweth discord . </s>
<s> Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly ; suddenly shall he be
broken without remedy . </s>
<s> These six things doth the LORD hate : yea , seven are an
abomination unto him : A proud look , a lying tongue , and hands
that shed innocent blood , An heart that deviseth wicked
imaginations , feet that be swift in running to mischief , A false
witness that speaketh lies , and he that soweth discord among brethren . </s>
<s> My son , keep thy father 's commandment , and forsake not the law of
thy mother : Bind them continually upon thine heart , and tie them
about thy neck . </s>
<s> When thou goest , it shall lead thee ; when thou sleepest , it shall
keep thee ; and when thou awakest , it shall talk with thee . </s>
<s> For the commandment is a lamp ; and the law is light ; and reproofs
of instruction are the way of life : To keep thee from the evil
woman , from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman . </s>
<s> Lust not after her beauty in thine heart ; neither let her take
thee with her eyelids . </s>
<s> For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of
bread : and the adultress will hunt for the precious life . </s>
<s> Can a man take fire in his bosom , and his clothes not be burned ? </s>
<s> Can one go upon hot coals , and his feet not be burned ? </s>
<s>  So
he that goeth in to his neighbour 's wife ; whosoever toucheth her shall
not be innocent . </s>
<s> Men do not despise a thief , if he steal to satisfy his soul when
he is hungry ; But if he be found , he shall restore sevenfold ; he
shall give all the substance of his house . </s>
<s> But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding :
he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul . </s>
<s> A wound and dishonour shall he get ; and his reproach shall not be
wiped away . </s>
<s> For jealousy is the rage of a man : therefore he will not spare in
the day of vengeance . </s>
<s> He will not regard any ransom ; neither will he rest content ,
though thou givest many gifts . </s>
<s> My son , keep my words , and lay up my commandments with thee . </s>
<s> Keep my commandments , and live ; and my law as the apple of thine
eye . </s>
<s> Bind them upon thy fingers , write them upon the table of thine
heart . </s>
<s> Say unto wisdom , Thou art my sister ; and call understanding thy
kinswoman : 7 :5 That they may keep thee from the strange woman , from
the stranger which flattereth with her words . </s>
<s> For at the window of my house I looked through my casement , 7 :7
And beheld among the simple ones , I discerned among the youths , a
young man void of understanding , 7 :8 Passing through the street near
her corner ; and he went the way to her house , 7 :9 In the twilight , in
the evening , in the black and dark night : And , behold , there met
him a woman with the attire of an harlot , and subtil of heart . </s>
<s> (She is loud and stubborn ; her feet abide not in her house : 
Now is she without , now in the streets , and lieth in wait at every
corner . </s>
<s>  So she caught him , and kissed him , and with an impudent
face said unto him , I have peace offerings with me ; this day have
I payed my vows . </s>
<s> Therefore came I forth to meet thee , diligently to seek thy face ,
and I have found thee . </s>
<s> I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry , with carved
works , with fine linen of Egypt . </s>
<s> I have perfumed my bed with myrrh , aloes , and cinnamon . </s>
<s> Come , let us take our fill of love until the morning : let us
solace ourselves with loves . </s>
<s> For the goodman is not at home , he is gone a long journey : 
He hath taken a bag of money with him , and will come home at the day
appointed . </s>
<s> With her much fair speech she caused him to yield , with the
flattering of her lips she forced him . </s>
<s> He goeth after her straightway , as an ox goeth to the slaughter ,
or as a fool to the correction of the stocks ; Till a dart strike
through his liver ; as a bird hasteth to the snare , and knoweth not
that it is for his life . </s>
<s> Hearken unto me now therefore , O ye children , and attend to the
words of my mouth . </s>
<s> Let not thine heart decline to her ways , go not astray in her
paths . </s>
<s> For she hath cast down many wounded : yea , many strong men have
been slain by her . </s>
<s> Her house is the way to hell , going down to the chambers of
death . </s>
<s> Doth not wisdom cry ? </s>
<s> and understanding put forth her voice ? </s>
<s> 8 :2
She standeth in the top of high places , by the way in the places of
the paths . </s>
<s> She crieth at the gates , at the entry of the city , at the coming
in at the doors . </s>
<s> Unto you , O men , I call ; and my voice is to the sons of man . </s>
<s> O ye simple , understand wisdom : and , ye fools , be ye of an
understanding heart . </s>
<s> Hear ; for I will speak of excellent things ; and the opening of my
lips shall be right things . </s>
<s> For my mouth shall speak truth ; and wickedness is an abomination
to my lips . </s>
<s> All the words of my mouth are in righteousness ; there is nothing
froward or perverse in them . </s>
<s> They are all plain to him that understandeth , and right to them
that find knowledge . </s>
<s> Receive my instruction , and not silver ; and knowledge rather than
choice gold . </s>
<s> For wisdom is better than rubies ; and all the things that may be
desired are not to be compared to it . </s>
<s> I wisdom dwell with prudence , and find out knowledge of witty
inventions . </s>
<s> The fear of the LORD is to hate evil : pride , and arrogancy , and
the evil way , and the froward mouth , do I hate . </s>
<s> Counsel is mine , and sound wisdom : I am understanding ; I have
strength . </s>
<s> By me kings reign , and princes decree justice . </s>
<s> By me princes rule , and nobles , even all the judges of the earth . </s>
<s> I love them that love me ; and those that seek me early shall find
me . </s>
<s> Riches and honour are with me ; yea , durable riches and
righteousness . </s>
<s> My fruit is better than gold , yea , than fine gold ; and my revenue
than choice silver . </s>
<s> I lead in the way of righteousness , in the midst of the paths of
judgment : That I may cause those that love me to inherit
substance ; and I will fill their treasures . </s>
<s> The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his way , before his
works of old . </s>
<s> I was set up from everlasting , from the beginning , or ever the
earth was . </s>
<s> When there were no depths , I was brought forth ; when there were
no fountains abounding with water . </s>
<s> Before the mountains were settled , before the hills was I brought
forth : While as yet he had not made the earth , nor the fields ,
nor the highest part of the dust of the world . </s>
<s> When he prepared the heavens , I was there : when he set a compass
upon the face of the depth : When he established the clouds above :
when he strengthened the fountains of the deep : When he gave to
the sea his decree , that the waters should not pass his commandment :
when he appointed the foundations of the earth : Then I was by
him , as one brought up with him : and I was daily his delight ,
rejoicing always before him ; Rejoicing in the habitable part of
his earth ; and my delights were with the sons of men . </s>
<s> Now therefore hearken unto me , O ye children : for blessed are
they that keep my ways . </s>
<s> Hear instruction , and be wise , and refuse it not . </s>
<s> Blessed is the man that heareth me , watching daily at my gates ,
waiting at the posts of my doors . </s>
<s> For whoso findeth me findeth life , and shall obtain favour of the
LORD . </s>
<s> But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul : all they
that hate me love death . </s>
<s> Wisdom hath builded her house , she hath hewn out her seven
pillars : 9 :2 She hath killed her beasts ; she hath mingled her wine ;
she hath also furnished her table . </s>
<s> She hath sent forth her maidens : she crieth upon the highest
places of the city , 9 :4 Whoso is simple , let him turn in hither : as
for him that wanteth understanding , she saith to him , 9 :5 Come , eat of
my bread , and drink of the wine which I have mingled . </s>
<s> Forsake the foolish , and live ; and go in the way of understanding . </s>
<s> He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame : and he that
rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot . </s>
<s> Reprove not a scorner , lest he hate thee : rebuke a wise man , and
he will love thee . </s>
<s> Give instruction to a wise man , and he will be yet wiser : teach a
just man , and he will increase in learning . </s>
<s> The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom : and the
knowledge of the holy is understanding . </s>
<s> For by me thy days shall be multiplied , and the years of thy life
shall be increased . </s>
<s> If thou be wise , thou shalt be wise for thyself : but if thou
scornest , thou alone shalt bear it . </s>
<s> A foolish woman is clamorous : she is simple , and knoweth nothing . </s>
<s> For she sitteth at the door of her house , on a seat in the high
places of the city , To call passengers who go right on their
ways : Whoso is simple , let him turn in hither : and as for him
that wanteth understanding , she saith to him , Stolen waters are
sweet , and bread eaten in secret is pleasant . </s>
<s> But he knoweth not that the dead are there ; and that her guests
are in the depths of hell . </s>
<s> The proverbs of Solomon . </s>
<s> A wise son maketh a glad father : but a
foolish son is the heaviness of his mother . </s>
<s> Treasures of wickedness profit nothing : but righteousness
delivereth from death . </s>
<s> The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish : but
he casteth away the substance of the wicked . </s>
<s> He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand : but the hand of
the diligent maketh rich . </s>
<s> He that gathereth in summer is a wise son : but he that sleepeth
in harvest is a son that causeth shame . </s>
<s> Blessings are upon the head of the just : but violence covereth
the mouth of the wicked . </s>
<s> The memory of the just is blessed : but the name of the wicked
shall rot . </s>
<s> The wise in heart will receive commandments : but a prating fool
shall fall . </s>
<s> He that walketh uprightly walketh surely : but he that perverteth
his ways shall be known . </s>
<s> He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow : but a prating fool
shall fall . </s>
<s> The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life : but violence
covereth the mouth of the wicked . </s>
<s> Hatred stirreth up strifes : but love covereth all sins . </s>
<s> In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found : but
a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding . </s>
<s> Wise men lay up knowledge : but the mouth of the foolish is near
destruction . </s>
<s> The rich man 's wealth is his strong city : the destruction of the
poor is their poverty . </s>
<s> The labour of the righteous tendeth to life : the fruit of the
wicked to sin . </s>
<s> He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction : but he that
refuseth reproof erreth . </s>
<s> He that hideth hatred with lying lips , and he that uttereth a
slander , is a fool . </s>
<s> In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin : but he that
refraineth his lips is wise . </s>
<s> The tongue of the just is as choice silver : the heart of the
wicked is little worth . </s>
<s> The lips of the righteous feed many : but fools die for want of
wisdom . </s>
<s> The blessing of the LORD , it maketh rich , and he addeth no
sorrow with it . </s>
<s> It is as sport to a fool to do mischief : but a man of
understanding hath wisdom . </s>
<s> The fear of the wicked , it shall come upon him : but the desire
of the righteous shall be granted . </s>
<s> As the whirlwind passeth , so is the wicked no more : but the
righteous is an everlasting foundation . </s>
<s> As vinegar to the teeth , and as smoke to the eyes , so is the
sluggard to them that send him . </s>
<s> The fear of the LORD prolongeth days : but the years of the
wicked shall be shortened . </s>
<s> The hope of the righteous shall be gladness : but the expectation
of the wicked shall perish . </s>
<s> The way of the LORD is strength to the upright : but destruction
shall be to the workers of iniquity . </s>
<s> The righteous shall never be removed : but the wicked shall not
inhabit the earth . </s>
<s> The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom : but the froward
tongue shall be cut out . </s>
<s> The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable : but the mouth
of the wicked speaketh frowardness . </s>
<s> A false balance is abomination to the LORD : but a just weight is
his delight . </s>
<s> When pride cometh , then cometh shame : but with the lowly is
wisdom . </s>
<s> The integrity of the upright shall guide them : but the
perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them . </s>
<s> Riches profit not in the day of wrath : but righteousness
delivereth from death . </s>
<s> The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way : but the
wicked shall fall by his own wickedness . </s>
<s> The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them : but
transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness . </s>
<s> When a wicked man dieth , his expectation shall perish : and the
hope of unjust men perisheth . </s>
<s> The righteous is delivered out of trouble , and the wicked cometh
in his stead . </s>
<s> An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour : but through
knowledge shall the just be delivered . </s>
<s> When it goeth well with the righteous , the city rejoiceth : and
when the wicked perish , there is shouting . </s>
<s> By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted : but it is
overthrown by the mouth of the wicked . </s>
<s> He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour : but a man of
understanding holdeth his peace . </s>
<s> A talebearer revealeth secrets : but he that is of a faithful
spirit concealeth the matter . </s>
<s> Where no counsel is , the people fall : but in the multitude of
counsellors there is safety . </s>
<s> He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it : and he that
hateth suretiship is sure . </s>
<s> A gracious woman retaineth honour : and strong men retain riches . </s>
<s> The merciful man doeth good to his own soul : but he that is
cruel troubleth his own flesh . </s>
<s> The wicked worketh a deceitful work : but to him that soweth
righteousness shall be a sure reward . </s>
<s> As righteousness tendeth to life : so he that pursueth evil
pursueth it to his own death . </s>
<s> They that are of a froward heart are abomination to the LORD :
but such as are upright in their way are his delight . </s>
<s> Though hand join in hand , the wicked shall not be unpunished :
but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered . </s>
<s> As a jewel of gold in a swine 's snout , so is a fair woman which
is without discretion . </s>
<s> The desire of the righteous is only good : but the expectation of
the wicked is wrath . </s>
<s> There is that scattereth , and yet increaseth ; and there is that
withholdeth more than is meet , but it tendeth to poverty . </s>
<s> The liberal soul shall be made fat : and he that watereth shall
be watered also himself . </s>
<s> He that withholdeth corn , the people shall curse him : but
blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it . </s>
<s> He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour : but he that
seeketh mischief , it shall come unto him . </s>
<s> He that trusteth in his riches shall fall ; but the righteous
shall flourish as a branch . </s>
<s> He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind : and the
fool shall be servant to the wise of heart . </s>
<s> The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life ; and he that
winneth souls is wise . </s>
<s> Behold , the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth : much
more the wicked and the sinner . </s>
<s> Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge : but he that hateth
reproof is brutish . </s>
<s> A good man obtaineth favour of the LORD : but a man of wicked
devices will he condemn . </s>
<s> A man shall not be established by wickedness : but the root of the
righteous shall not be moved . </s>
<s> A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband : but she that maketh
ashamed is as rottenness in his bones . </s>
<s> The thoughts of the righteous are right : but the counsels of the
wicked are deceit . </s>
<s> The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood : but the
mouth of the upright shall deliver them . </s>
<s> The wicked are overthrown , and are not : but the house of the
righteous shall stand . </s>
<s> A man shall be commended according to his wisdom : but he that is
of a perverse heart shall be despised . </s>
<s> He that is despised , and hath a servant , is better than he that
honoureth himself , and lacketh bread . </s>
<s> A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast : but the tender
mercies of the wicked are cruel . </s>
<s> He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread : but he
that followeth vain persons is void of understanding . </s>
<s> The wicked desireth the net of evil men : but the root of the
righteous yieldeth fruit . </s>
<s> The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips : but the
just shall come out of trouble . </s>
<s> A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth :
and the recompence of a man 's hands shall be rendered unto him . </s>
<s> The way of a fool is right in his own eyes : but he that
hearkeneth unto counsel is wise . </s>
<s> A fool 's wrath is presently known : but a prudent man covereth
shame . </s>
<s> He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness : but a false
witness deceit . </s>
<s> There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword : but the
tongue of the wise is health . </s>
<s> The lip of truth shall be established for ever : but a lying
tongue is but for a moment . </s>
<s> Deceit is in the heart of them that imagine evil : but to the
counsellors of peace is joy . </s>
<s> There shall no evil happen to the just : but the wicked shall be
filled with mischief . </s>
<s> Lying lips are abomination to the LORD : but they that deal truly
are his delight . </s>
<s> A prudent man concealeth knowledge : but the heart of fools
proclaimeth foolishness . </s>
<s> The hand of the diligent shall bear rule : but the slothful shall
be under tribute . </s>
<s> Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop : but a good word
maketh it glad . </s>
<s> The righteous is more excellent than his neighbour : but the way
of the wicked seduceth them . </s>
<s> The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting : but
the substance of a diligent man is precious . </s>
<s> In the way of righteousness is life : and in the pathway thereof
there is no death . </s>
<s> A wise son heareth his father 's instruction : but a scorner
heareth not rebuke . </s>
<s> A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth : but the soul of
the transgressors shall eat violence . </s>
<s> He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life : but he that openeth
wide his lips shall have destruction . </s>
<s> The soul of the sluggard desireth , and hath nothing : but the soul
of the diligent shall be made fat . </s>
<s> A righteous man hateth lying : but a wicked man is loathsome , and
cometh to shame . </s>
<s> Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way : but
wickedness overthroweth the sinner . </s>
<s> There is that maketh himself rich , yet hath nothing : there is
that maketh himself poor , yet hath great riches . </s>
<s> The ransom of a man 's life are his riches : but the poor heareth
not rebuke . </s>
<s> The light of the righteous rejoiceth : but the lamp of the wicked
shall be put out . </s>
<s> Only by pride cometh contention : but with the well advised is
wisdom . </s>
<s> Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished : but he that
gathereth by labour shall increase . </s>
<s> Hope deferred maketh the heart sick : but when the desire cometh ,
it is a tree of life . </s>
<s> Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed : but he that feareth
the commandment shall be rewarded . </s>
<s> The law of the wise is a fountain of life , to depart from the
snares of death . </s>
<s> Good understanding giveth favour : but the way of transgressors
is hard . </s>
<s> Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge : but a fool layeth open
his folly . </s>
<s> A wicked messenger falleth into mischief : but a faithful
ambassador is health . </s>
<s> Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction : but
he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured . </s>
<s> The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul : but it is
abomination to fools to depart from evil . </s>
<s> He that walketh with wise men shall be wise : but a companion of
fools shall be destroyed . </s>
<s> Evil pursueth sinners : but to the righteous good shall be
repayed . </s>
<s> A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children 's children :
and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just . </s>
<s> Much food is in the tillage of the poor : but there is that is
destroyed for want of judgment . </s>
<s> He that spareth his rod hateth his son : but he that loveth him
chasteneth him betimes . </s>
<s> The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul : but the
belly of the wicked shall want . </s>
<s> Every wise woman buildeth her house : but the foolish plucketh it
down with her hands . </s>
<s> He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD : but he that
is perverse in his ways despiseth him . </s>
<s> In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride : but the lips of
the wise shall preserve them . </s>
<s> Where no oxen are , the crib is clean : but much increase is by the
strength of the ox . </s>
<s> A faithful witness will not lie : but a false witness will utter
lies . </s>
<s> A scorner seeketh wisdom , and findeth it not : but knowledge is
easy unto him that understandeth . </s>
<s> Go from the presence of a foolish man , when thou perceivest not
in him the lips of knowledge . </s>
<s> The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way : but the folly
of fools is deceit . </s>
<s> Fools make a mock at sin : but among the righteous there is
favour . </s>
<s> The heart knoweth his own bitterness ; and a stranger doth not
intermeddle with his joy . </s>
<s> The house of the wicked shall be overthrown : but the tabernacle
of the upright shall flourish . </s>
<s> There is a way which seemeth right unto a man , but the end
thereof are the ways of death . </s>
<s> Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful ; and the end of that
mirth is heaviness . </s>
<s> The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways : and a
good man shall be satisfied from himself . </s>
<s> The simple believeth every word : but the prudent man looketh
well to his going . </s>
<s> A wise man feareth , and departeth from evil : but the fool
rageth , and is confident . </s>
<s> He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly : and a man of wicked
devices is hated . </s>
<s> The simple inherit folly : but the prudent are crowned with
knowledge . </s>
<s> The evil bow before the good ; and the wicked at the gates of the
righteous . </s>
<s> The poor is hated even of his own neighbour : but the rich hath
many friends . </s>
<s> He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth : but he that hath mercy
on the poor , happy is he . </s>
<s> Do they not err that devise evil ? </s>
<s> but mercy and truth shall be
to them that devise good . </s>
<s> In all labour there is profit : but the talk of the lips tendeth
only to penury . </s>
<s> The crown of the wise is their riches : but the foolishness of
fools is folly . </s>
<s> A true witness delivereth souls : but a deceitful witness
speaketh lies . </s>
<s> In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence : and his children
shall have a place of refuge . </s>
<s> The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life , to depart from the
snares of death . </s>
<s> In the multitude of people is the king 's honour : but in the want
of people is the destruction of the prince . </s>
<s> He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding : but he that
is hasty of spirit exalteth folly . </s>
<s> A sound heart is the life of the flesh : but envy the rottenness
of the bones . </s>
<s> He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker : but he that
honoureth him hath mercy on the poor . </s>
<s> The wicked is driven away in his wickedness : but the righteous
hath hope in his death . </s>
<s> Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding : but
that which is in the midst of fools is made known . </s>
<s> Righteousness exalteth a nation : but sin is a reproach to any
people . </s>
<s> The king 's favour is toward a wise servant : but his wrath is
against him that causeth shame . </s>
<s> A soft answer turneth away wrath : but grievous words stir up
anger . </s>
<s> The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright : but the mouth of
fools poureth out foolishness . </s>
<s> The eyes of the LORD are in every place , beholding the evil and
the good . </s>
<s> A wholesome tongue is a tree of life : but perverseness therein is
a breach in the spirit . </s>
<s> A fool despiseth his father 's instruction : but he that regardeth
reproof is prudent . </s>
<s> In the house of the righteous is much treasure : but in the
revenues of the wicked is trouble . </s>
<s> The lips of the wise disperse knowledge : but the heart of the
foolish doeth not so . </s>
<s> The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD : but
the prayer of the upright is his delight . </s>
<s> The way of the wicked is an abomination unto the LORD : but he
loveth him that followeth after righteousness . </s>
<s> Correction is grievous unto him that forsaketh the way : and he
that hateth reproof shall die . </s>
<s> Hell and destruction are before the LORD : how much more then the
hearts of the children of men ? </s>
<s>  A scorner loveth not one that
reproveth him : neither will he go unto the wise . </s>
<s> A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance : but by sorrow of
the heart the spirit is broken . </s>
<s> The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge : but
the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness . </s>
<s> All the days of the afflicted are evil : but he that is of a
merry heart hath a continual feast . </s>
<s> Better is little with the fear of the LORD than great treasure
and trouble therewith . </s>
<s> Better is a dinner of herbs where love is , than a stalled ox and
hatred therewith . </s>
<s> A wrathful man stirreth up strife : but he that is slow to anger
appeaseth strife . </s>
<s> The way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns : but the
way of the righteous is made plain . </s>
<s> A wise son maketh a glad father : but a foolish man despiseth his
mother . </s>
<s> Folly is joy to him that is destitute of wisdom : but a man of
understanding walketh uprightly . </s>
<s> Without counsel purposes are disappointed : but in the multitude
of counsellors they are established . </s>
<s> A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth : and a word spoken in
due season , how good is it ! </s>
<s>  The way of life is above to the
wise , that he may depart from hell beneath . </s>
<s> The LORD will destroy the house of the proud : but he will
establish the border of the widow . </s>
<s> The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the LORD : but
the words of the pure are pleasant words . </s>
<s> He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house ; but he that
hateth gifts shall live . </s>
<s> The heart of the righteous studieth to answer : but the mouth of
the wicked poureth out evil things . </s>
<s> The LORD is far from the wicked : but he heareth the prayer of
the righteous . </s>
<s> The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart : and a good report
maketh the bones fat . </s>
<s> The ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise . </s>
<s> He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul : but he that
heareth reproof getteth understanding . </s>
<s> The fear of the LORD is the instruction of wisdom ; and before
honour is humility . </s>
<s> The preparations of the heart in man , and the answer of the
tongue , is from the LORD . </s>
<s> All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes ; but the LORD

<s> Commit thy works unto the LORD , and thy thoughts shall be
established . </s>
<s> The LORD hath made all things for himself : yea , even the wicked
for the day of evil . </s>
<s> Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD :
though hand join in hand , he shall not be unpunished . </s>
<s> By mercy and truth iniquity is purged : and by the fear of the
LORD men depart from evil . </s>
<s> When a man 's ways please the LORD , he maketh even his enemies to
be at peace with him . </s>
<s> Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without
right . </s>
<s> A man 's heart deviseth his way : but the LORD directeth his steps . </s>
<s> A divine sentence is in the lips of the king : his mouth
transgresseth not in judgment . </s>
<s> A just weight and balance are the LORD 's : all the weights of the
bag are his work . </s>
<s> It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness : for the
throne is established by righteousness . </s>
<s> Righteous lips are the delight of kings ; and they love him that
speaketh right . </s>
<s> The wrath of a king is as messengers of death : but a wise man
will pacify it . </s>
<s> In the light of the king 's countenance is life ; and his favour
is as a cloud of the latter rain . </s>
<s> How much better is it to get wisdom than gold ! </s>
<s> and to get
understanding rather to be chosen than silver ! </s>
<s>  The highway of
the upright is to depart from evil : he that keepeth his way preserveth
his soul . </s>
<s> Pride goeth before destruction , and an haughty spirit before a
fall . </s>
<s> Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly , than to
divide the spoil with the proud . </s>
<s> He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good : and whoso
trusteth in the LORD , happy is he . </s>
<s> The wise in heart shall be called prudent : and the sweetness of
the lips increaseth learning . </s>
<s> Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it : but
the instruction of fools is folly . </s>
<s> The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth , and addeth learning to

<s> Pleasant words are as an honeycomb , sweet to the soul , and
health to the bones . </s>
<s> There is a way that seemeth right unto a man , but the end
thereof are the ways of death . </s>
<s> He that laboureth laboureth for himself ; for his mouth craveth

<s> An ungodly man diggeth up evil : and in his lips there is as a

<s> A froward man soweth strife : and a whisperer separateth chief

<s> A violent man enticeth his neighbour , and leadeth him into the

<s> He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things : moving his lips

<s> The hoary head is a crown of glory , if it be found in the way of
righteousness . </s>
<s> He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty ; and he that
ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city . </s>
<s> The lot is cast into the lap ; but the whole disposing thereof is
of the LORD . </s>
<s> Better is a dry morsel , and quietness therewith , than an house
full of sacrifices with strife . </s>
<s> A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame , and

<s> The fining pot is for silver , and the furnace for gold : but the

<s> A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips ; and a liar giveth ear to

<s> Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker : and he that is glad

<s> Children 's children are the crown of old men ; and the glory of

<s> Excellent speech becometh not a fool : much less do lying lips a

<s> A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it :

<s> He that covereth a transgression seeketh love ; but he that

<s> A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes
into a fool . </s>
<s> An evil man seeketh only rebellion : therefore a cruel messenger
shall be sent against him . </s>
<s> Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man , rather than a fool

<s> Whoso rewardeth evil for good , evil shall not depart from his
house . </s>
<s> The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water :
therefore leave off contention , before it be meddled with . </s>
<s> He that justifieth the wicked , and he that condemneth the just ,
even they both are abomination to the LORD . </s>
<s> Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom ,
seeing he hath no heart to it ? </s>
<s>  A friend loveth at all times ,
and a brother is born for adversity . </s>
<s> A man void of understanding striketh hands , and becometh surety
in the presence of his friend . </s>
<s> He loveth transgression that loveth strife : and he that exalteth

<s> He that hath a froward heart findeth no good : and he that hath a
perverse tongue falleth into mischief . </s>
<s> He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow : and the father

<s> A merry heart doeth good like a medicine : but a broken spirit

<s> A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways

<s> Wisdom is before him that hath understanding ; but the eyes of a

<s> A foolish son is a grief to his father , and bitterness to her

<s> Also to punish the just is not good , nor to strike princes for
equity . </s>
<s> He that hath knowledge spareth his words : and a man of
understanding is of an excellent spirit . </s>
<s> Even a fool , when he holdeth his peace , is counted wise : and he

<s> Through desire a man , having separated himself , seeketh and

<s> A fool hath no delight in understanding , but that his heart may

<s> When the wicked cometh , then cometh also contempt , and with

<s> The words of a man 's mouth are as deep waters , and the wellspring

<s> It is not good to accept the person of the wicked , to overthrow
the righteous in judgment . </s>
<s> A fool 's lips enter into contention , and his mouth calleth for

<s> A fool 's mouth is his destruction , and his lips are the snare of

<s> The words of a talebearer are as wounds , and they go down into

<s> He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a

<s> The name of the LORD is a strong tower : the righteous runneth

<s> The rich man 's wealth is his strong city , and as an high wall in

<s> Before destruction the heart of man is haughty , and before

<s> He that answereth a matter before he heareth it , it is folly and

<s> The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity ; but a wounded

<s>  The heart of the prudent getteth

<s> A man 's gift maketh room for him , and bringeth him before great

<s> The lot causeth contentions to cease , and parteth between the

<s> A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city : and

<s> A man 's belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth ;

<s> Death and life are in the power of the tongue : and they that

<s> Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing , and obtaineth favour

<s> Also , that the soul be without knowledge , it is not good ; and he

<s> The foolishness of man perverteth his way : and his heart fretteth

<s> Wealth maketh many friends ; but the poor is separated from his

<s> A false witness shall not be unpunished , and he that speaketh

<s> for her price is far above

<s> She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life . </s>

<s> She considereth a field , and buyeth it : with the fruit of her

<s> She girdeth her loins with strength , and strengtheneth her arms . </s>
<s> She perceiveth that her merchandise is good : her candle goeth

<s> She layeth her hands to the spindle , and her hands hold the

<s> She stretcheth out her hand to the poor ; yea , she reacheth forth

<s> She is not afraid of the snow for her household : for all her

<s> She maketh herself coverings of tapestry ; her clothing is silk

<s> Her husband is known in the gates , when he sitteth among the

<s> She maketh fine linen , and selleth it ; and delivereth girdles

<s> Strength and honour are her clothing ; and she shall rejoice in
time to come . </s>
<s> She openeth her mouth with wisdom ; and in her tongue is the law
of kindness . </s>
<s> She looketh well to the ways of her household , and eateth not
the bread of idleness . </s>
<s> Her children arise up , and call her blessed ; her husband also ,

<s> Many daughters have done virtuously , but thou excellest them
all . </s>
<s> Favour is deceitful , and beauty is vain : but a woman that

<s> Give her of the fruit of her hands ; and let her own works praise
her in the gates . </s>

1 :1 The words of the Preacher , the son of David , king in Jerusalem . </s>
<s> Vanity of vanities , saith the Preacher , vanity of vanities ; all is
vanity . </s>
<s> What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under the
sun ? </s>
<s> 1 :4 One generation passeth away , and another generation cometh :
but the earth abideth for ever . </s>
<s> The sun also ariseth , and the sun goeth down , and hasteth to his
place where he arose . </s>
<s> The wind goeth toward the south , and turneth about unto the north ;
it whirleth about continually , and the wind returneth again according
to his circuits . </s>
<s> All the rivers run into the sea ; yet the sea is not full ; unto the
place from whence the rivers come , thither they return again . </s>
<s> All things are full of labour ; man cannot utter it : the eye is not
satisfied with seeing , nor the ear filled with hearing . </s>
<s> The thing that hath been , it is that which shall be ; and that
which is done is that which shall be done : and there is no new thing
under the sun . </s>
<s> Is there any thing whereof it may be said , See , this is new ? </s>
<s> it
hath been already of old time , which was before us . </s>
<s> There is no remembrance of former things ; neither shall there be
any remembrance of things that are to come with those that shall come
after . </s>
<s> I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem . </s>
<s> And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning
all things that are done under heaven : this sore travail hath God
given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith . </s>
<s> I have seen all the works that are done under the sun ; and ,
behold , all is vanity and vexation of spirit . </s>
<s> That which is crooked cannot be made straight : and that which is
wanting cannot be numbered . </s>
<s> I communed with mine own heart , saying , Lo , I am come to great
estate , and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been
before me in Jerusalem : yea , my heart had great experience of wisdom
and knowledge . </s>
<s> And I gave my heart to know wisdom , and to know madness and
folly : I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit . </s>
<s> For in much wisdom is much grief : and he that increaseth
knowledge increaseth sorrow . </s>
<s> I said in mine heart , Go to now , I will prove thee with mirth ,
therefore enjoy pleasure : and , behold , this also is vanity . </s>
<s> I said of laughter , It is mad : and of mirth , What doeth it ? </s>
<s> 2 :3 I
sought in mine heart to give myself unto wine , yet acquainting mine
heart with wisdom ; and to lay hold on folly , till I might see what was
that good for the sons of men , which they should do under the heaven
all the days of their life . </s>
<s> I made me great works ; I builded me houses ; I planted me
vineyards : 2 :5 I made me gardens and orchards , and I planted trees in
them of all kind of fruits : 2 :6 I made me pools of water , to water
therewith the wood that bringeth forth trees : 2 :7 I got me servants
and maidens , and had servants born in my house ; also I had great
possessions of great and small cattle above all that were in Jerusalem
before me : 2 :8 I gathered me also silver and gold , and the peculiar
treasure of kings and of the provinces : I gat me men singers and women
singers , and the delights of the sons of men , as musical instruments ,
and that of all sorts . </s>
<s> So I was great , and increased more than all that were before me in
Jerusalem : also my wisdom remained with me . </s>
<s> And whatsoever mine eyes desired I kept not from them , I withheld
not my heart from any joy ; for my heart rejoiced in all my labour : and
this was my portion of all my labour . </s>
<s> Then I looked on all the works that my hands had wrought , and on
the labour that I had laboured to do : and , behold , all was vanity and
vexation of spirit , and there was no profit under the sun . </s>
<s> And I turned myself to behold wisdom , and madness , and folly : for
what can the man do that cometh after the king ? </s>
<s> even that which hath
been already done . </s>
<s> Then I saw that wisdom excelleth folly , as far as light excelleth
darkness . </s>
<s> The wise man 's eyes are in his head ; but the fool walketh in
darkness : and I myself perceived also that one event happeneth to them
all . </s>
<s> Then said I in my heart , As it happeneth to the fool , so it
happeneth even to me ; and why was I then more wise ? </s>
<s> Then I said in my
heart , that this also is vanity . </s>
<s> For there is no remembrance of the wise more than of the fool for
ever ; seeing that which now is in the days to come shall all be
forgotten . </s>
<s> how dieth the wise man ? </s>
<s> as the fool . </s>
<s> Therefore I hated life ; because the work that is wrought under
the sun is grievous unto me : for all is vanity and vexation of spirit . </s>
<s> Yea , I hated all my labour which I had taken under the sun :
because I should leave it unto the man that shall be after me . </s>
<s> And who knoweth whether he shall be a wise man or a fool ? </s>
<s> yet
shall he have rule over all my labour wherein I have laboured , and
wherein I have shewed myself wise under the sun . </s>
<s> This is also vanity . </s>
<s> Therefore I went about to cause my heart to despair of all the
labour which I took under the sun . </s>
<s> For there is a man whose labour is in wisdom , and in knowledge ,
and in equity ; yet to a man that hath not laboured therein shall he
leave it for his portion . </s>
<s> This also is vanity and a great evil . </s>
<s> For what hath man of all his labour , and of the vexation of his
heart , wherein he hath laboured under the sun ? </s>
<s>  For all his days
are sorrows , and his travail grief ; yea , his heart taketh not rest in
the night . </s>
<s> This is also vanity . </s>
<s> There is nothing better for a man , than that he should eat and
drink , and that he should make his soul enjoy good in his labour . </s>
<s> This
also I saw , that it was from the hand of God . </s>
<s> For who can eat , or who else can hasten hereunto , more than I ? </s>
<s> For God giveth to a man that is good in his sight wisdom , and
knowledge , and joy : but to the sinner he giveth travail , to gather and
to heap up , that he may give to him that is good before God . </s>
<s> This also
is vanity and vexation of spirit . </s>
<s> To every thing there is a season , and a time to every purpose
under the heaven : 3 :2 A time to be born , and a time to die ; a time to
plant , and a time to pluck up that which is planted ; 3 :3 A time to
kill , and a time to heal ; a time to break down , and a time to build
up ; 3 :4 A time to weep , and a time to laugh ; a time to mourn , and a
time to dance ; 3 :5 A time to cast away stones , and a time to gather
stones together ; a time to embrace , and a time to refrain from
embracing ; 3 :6 A time to get , and a time to lose ; a time to keep , and
a time to cast away ; 3 :7 A time to rend , and a time to sew ; a time to
keep silence , and a time to speak ; 3 :8 A time to love , and a time to
hate ; a time of war , and a time of peace . </s>
<s> What profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboureth ? </s>
<s> I have seen the travail , which God hath given to the sons of men
to be exercised in it . </s>
<s> He hath made every thing beautiful in his time : also he hath set
the world in their heart , so that no man can find out the work that
God maketh from the beginning to the end . </s>
<s> I know that there is no good in them , but for a man to rejoice ,
and to do good in his life . </s>
<s> And also that every man should eat and drink , and enjoy the good
of all his labour , it is the gift of God . </s>
<s> I know that , whatsoever God doeth , it shall be for ever : nothing
can be put to it , nor any thing taken from it : and God doeth it , that
men should fear before him . </s>
<s> That which hath been is now ; and that which is to be hath already
been ; and God requireth that which is past . </s>
<s> And moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment , that
wickedness was there ; and the place of righteousness , that iniquity
was there . </s>
<s> I said in mine heart , God shall judge the righteous and the
wicked : for there is a time there for every purpose and for every
work . </s>
<s> I said in mine heart concerning the estate of the sons of men ,
that God might manifest them , and that they might see that they
themselves are beasts . </s>
<s> For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts ; even
one thing befalleth them : as the one dieth , so dieth the other ; yea ,
they have all one breath ; so that a man hath no preeminence above a
beast : for all is vanity . </s>
<s> All go unto one place ; all are of the dust , and all turn to dust
again . </s>
<s> Who knoweth the spirit of man that goeth upward , and the spirit
of the beast that goeth downward to the earth ? </s>
<s>  Wherefore I
perceive that there is nothing better , than that a man should rejoice
in his own works ; for that is his portion : for who shall bring him to
see what shall be after him ? </s>
<s> 4 :1 So I returned , and considered all
the oppressions that are done under the sun : and behold the tears of
such as were oppressed , and they had no comforter ; and on the side of
their oppressors there was power ; but they had no comforter . </s>
<s> Wherefore I praised the dead which are already dead more than the
living which are yet alive . </s>
<s> Yea , better is he than both they , which hath not yet been , who
hath not seen the evil work that is done under the sun . </s>
<s> Again , I considered all travail , and every right work , that for
this a man is envied of his neighbour . </s>
<s> This is also vanity and
vexation of spirit . </s>
<s> The fool foldeth his hands together , and eateth his own flesh . </s>
<s> Better is an handful with quietness , than both the hands full with
travail and vexation of spirit . </s>
<s> Then I returned , and I saw vanity under the sun . </s>
<s> There is one alone , and there is not a second ; yea , he hath
neither child nor brother : yet is there no end of all his labour ;
neither is his eye satisfied with riches ; neither saith he , For whom
do I labour , and bereave my soul of good ? </s>
<s> This is also vanity , yea , it
is a sore travail . </s>
<s> Two are better than one ; because they have a good reward for their
labour . </s>
<s> For if they fall , the one will lift up his fellow : but woe to him
that is alone when he falleth ; for he hath not another to help him up . </s>
<s> Again , if two lie together , then they have heat : but how can one
be warm alone ? </s>
<s>  And if one prevail against him , two shall
withstand him ; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken . </s>
<s> Better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king ,
who will no more be admonished . </s>
<s> For out of prison he cometh to reign ; whereas also he that is
born in his kingdom becometh poor . </s>
<s> I considered all the living which walk under the sun , with the
second child that shall stand up in his stead . </s>
<s> There is no end of all the people , even of all that have been
before them : they also that come after shall not rejoice in him . </s>
<s> this also is vanity and vexation of spirit . </s>
<s> Keep thy foot when thou goest to the house of God , and be more
ready to hear , than to give the sacrifice of fools : for they consider
not that they do evil . </s>
<s> Be not rash with thy mouth , and let not thine heart be hasty to
utter any thing before God : for God is in heaven , and thou upon earth :
therefore let thy words be few . </s>
<s> For a dream cometh through the multitude of business ; and a fool 's
voice is known by multitude of words . </s>
<s> When thou vowest a vow unto God , defer not to pay it ; for he hath
no pleasure in fools : pay that which thou hast vowed . </s>
<s> Better is it that thou shouldest not vow , than that thou shouldest
vow and not pay . </s>
<s> Suffer not thy mouth to cause thy flesh to sin ; neither say thou
before the angel , that it was an error : wherefore should God be angry
at thy voice , and destroy the work of thine hands ? </s>
<s> 5 :7 For in the
multitude of dreams and many words there are also divers vanities : but
fear thou God . </s>
<s> If thou seest the oppression of the poor , and violent perverting
of judgment and justice in a province , marvel not at the matter : for
he that is higher than the highest regardeth ; and there be higher than
they . </s>
<s> Moreover the profit of the earth is for all : the king himself is
served by the field . </s>
<s> He that loveth silver shall not be satisfied with silver ; nor he
that loveth abundance with increase : this is also vanity . </s>
<s> When goods increase , they are increased that eat them : and what
good is there to the owners thereof , saving the beholding of them with
their eyes ? </s>
<s>  The sleep of a labouring man is sweet , whether he
eat little or much : but the abundance of the rich will not suffer him
to sleep . </s>
<s> There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun , namely ,
riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt . </s>
<s> But those riches perish by evil travail : and he begetteth a son ,
and there is nothing in his hand . </s>
<s> As he came forth of his mother 's womb , naked shall he return to
go as he came , and shall take nothing of his labour , which he may
carry away in his hand . </s>
<s> And this also is a sore evil , that in all points as he came , so
shall he go : and what profit hath he that hath laboured for the wind ? </s>
<s> All his days also he eateth in darkness , and he hath much sorrow
and wrath with his sickness . </s>
<s> Behold that which I have seen : it is good and comely for one to
eat and to drink , and to enjoy the good of all his labour that he
taketh under the sun all the days of his life , which God giveth him :
for it is his portion . </s>
<s> Every man also to whom God hath given riches and wealth , and hath
given him power to eat thereof , and to take his portion , and to
rejoice in his labour ; this is the gift of God . </s>
<s> For he shall not much remember the days of his life ; because God
answereth him in the joy of his heart . </s>
<s> There is an evil which I have seen under the sun , and it is common
among men : 6 :2 A man to whom God hath given riches , wealth , and
honour , so that he wanteth nothing for his soul of all that he
desireth , yet God giveth him not power to eat thereof , but a stranger
eateth it : this is vanity , and it is an evil disease . </s>
<s> If a man beget an hundred children , and live many years , so that
the days of his years be many , and his soul be not filled with good ,
and also that he have no burial ; I say , that an untimely birth is
better than he . </s>
<s> For he cometh in with vanity , and departeth in darkness , and his
name shall be covered with darkness . </s>
<s> Moreover he hath not seen the sun , nor known any thing : this hath
more rest than the other . </s>
<s> Yea , though he live a thousand years twice told , yet hath he seen
no good : do not all go to one place ? </s>
<s> 6 :7 All the labour of man is for
his mouth , and yet the appetite is not filled . </s>
<s> For what hath the wise more than the fool ? </s>
<s> what hath the poor ,
that knoweth to walk before the living ? </s>
<s> 6 :9 Better is the sight of
the eyes than the wandering of the desire : this is also vanity and
vexation of spirit . </s>
<s> That which hath been is named already , and it is known that it is
man : neither may he contend with him that is mightier than he . </s>
<s> Seeing there be many things that increase vanity , what is man the
better ? </s>
<s>  For who knoweth what is good for man in this life , all
the days of his vain life which he spendeth as a shadow ? </s>
<s> for who can
tell a man what shall be after him under the sun ? </s>
<s> 7 :1 A good name is
better than precious ointment ; and the day of death than the day of
one 's birth . </s>
<s> It is better to go to the house of mourning , than to go to the
house of feasting : for that is the end of all men ; and the living will
lay it to his heart . </s>
<s> Sorrow is better than laughter : for by the sadness of the
countenance the heart is made better . </s>
<s> The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning ; but the heart
of fools is in the house of mirth . </s>
<s> It is better to hear the rebuke of the wise , than for a man to
hear the song of fools . </s>
<s> For as the crackling of thorns under a pot , so is the laughter of
the fool : this also is vanity . </s>
<s> Surely oppression maketh a wise man mad ; and a gift destroyeth the
heart . </s>
<s> Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof : and the
patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit . </s>
<s> Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry : for anger resteth in the
bosom of fools . </s>
<s> Say not thou , What is the cause that the former days were better
than these ? </s>
<s> for thou dost not enquire wisely concerning this . </s>
<s> Wisdom is good with an inheritance : and by it there is profit to
them that see the sun . </s>
<s> For wisdom is a defence , and money is a defence : but the
excellency of knowledge is , that wisdom giveth life to them that have
it . </s>
<s> Consider the work of God : for who can make that straight , which
he hath made crooked ? </s>
<s>  In the day of prosperity be joyful , but in
the day of adversity consider : God also hath set the one over against
the other , to the end that man should find nothing after him . </s>
<s> All things have I seen in the days of my vanity : there is a just
man that perisheth in his righteousness , and there is a wicked man
that prolongeth his life in his wickedness . </s>
<s> Be not righteous over much ; neither make thyself over wise : why
shouldest thou destroy thyself  ? </s>
<s>  Be not over much wicked ,
neither be thou foolish : why shouldest thou die before thy time ? </s>
<s> 
It is good that thou shouldest take hold of this ; yea , also from this
withdraw not thine hand : for he that feareth God shall come forth of
them all . </s>
<s> Wisdom strengtheneth the wise more than ten mighty men which are
in the city . </s>
<s> For there is not a just man upon earth , that doeth good , and
sinneth not . </s>
<s> Also take no heed unto all words that are spoken ; lest thou hear
thy servant curse thee : For oftentimes also thine own heart
knoweth that thou thyself likewise hast cursed others . </s>
<s> All this have I proved by wisdom : I said , I will be wise ; but it
was far from me . </s>
<s> That which is far off , and exceeding deep , who can find it out ? </s>
<s> I applied mine heart to know , and to search , and to seek out
wisdom , and the reason of things , and to know the wickedness of folly ,
even of foolishness and madness : And I find more bitter than
death the woman , whose heart is snares and nets , and her hands as
bands : whoso pleaseth God shall escape from her ; but the sinner shall
be taken by her . </s>
<s> Behold , this have I found , saith the preacher , counting one by
one , to find out the account : Which yet my soul seeketh , but I
find not : one man among a thousand have I found ; but a woman among all
those have I not found . </s>
<s> Lo , this only have I found , that God hath made man upright ; but
they have sought out many inventions . </s>
<s> Who is as the wise man ? </s>
<s> and who knoweth the interpretation of a
thing ? </s>
<s> a man 's wisdom maketh his face to shine , and the boldness of
his face shall be changed . </s>
<s> I counsel thee to keep the king 's commandment , and that in regard
of the oath of God . </s>
<s> Be not hasty to go out of his sight : stand not in an evil thing ;
for he doeth whatsoever pleaseth him . </s>
<s> Where the word of a king is , there is power : and who may say unto
him , What doest thou ? </s>
<s> 8 :5 Whoso keepeth the commandment shall feel no
evil thing : and a wise man 's heart discerneth both time and judgment . </s>
<s> Because to every purpose there is time and judgment , therefore the
misery of man is great upon him . </s>
<s> For he knoweth not that which shall be : for who can tell him when
it shall be ? </s>
<s> 8 :8 There is no man that hath power over the spirit to
retain the spirit ; neither hath he power in the day of death : and
there is no discharge in that war ; neither shall wickedness deliver
those that are given to it . </s>
<s> All this have I seen , and applied my heart unto every work that is
done under the sun : there is a time wherein one man ruleth over
another to his own hurt . </s>
<s> And so I saw the wicked buried , who had come and gone from the
place of the holy , and they were forgotten in the city where they had
so done : this is also vanity . </s>
<s> Because sentence against an evil work is not executed speedily ,
therefore the heart of the sons of men is fully set in them to do
evil . </s>
<s> Though a sinner do evil an hundred times , and his days be
prolonged , yet surely I know that it shall be well with them that fear
God , which fear before him : But it shall not be well with the
wicked , neither shall he prolong his days , which are as a shadow ;
because he feareth not before God . </s>
<s> There is a vanity which is done upon the earth ; that there be
just men , unto whom it happeneth according to the work of the wicked ;
again , there be wicked men , to whom it happeneth according to the work
of the righteous : I said that this also is vanity . </s>
<s> Then I commended mirth , because a man hath no better thing under
the sun , than to eat , and to drink , and to be merry : for that shall
abide with him of his labour the days of his life , which God giveth
him under the sun . </s>
<s> When I applied mine heart to know wisdom , and to see the business
that is done upon the earth : (for also there is that neither day nor
night seeth sleep with his eyes :) Then I beheld all the work of
God , that a man cannot find out the work that is done under the sun :
because though a man labour to seek it out , yet he shall not find it ;
yea farther ; though a wise man think to know it , yet shall he not be
able to find it . </s>
<s> For all this I considered in my heart even to declare all this ,
that the righteous , and the wise , and their works , are in the hand of
God : no man knoweth either love or hatred by all that is before them . </s>
<s> All things come alike to all : there is one event to the righteous ,
and to the wicked ; to the good and to the clean , and to the unclean ;
to him that sacrificeth , and to him that sacrificeth not : as is the
good , so is the sinner ; and he that sweareth , as he that feareth an
oath . </s>
<s> This is an evil among all things that are done under the sun , that
there is one event unto all : yea , also the heart of the sons of men is
full of evil , and madness is in their heart while they live , and after
that they go to the dead . </s>
<s> For to him that is joined to all the living there is hope : for a
living dog is better than a dead lion . </s>
<s> For the living know that they shall die : but the dead know not any
thing , neither have they any more a reward ; for the memory of them is
forgotten . </s>
<s> Also their love , and their hatred , and their envy , is now
perished ; neither have they any more a portion for ever in any thing
that is done under the sun . </s>
<s> Go thy way , eat thy bread with joy , and drink thy wine with a
merry heart ; for God now accepteth thy works . </s>
<s> Let thy garments be always white ; and let thy head lack no
ointment . </s>
<s> Live joyfully with the wife whom thou lovest all the days of the
life of thy vanity , which he hath given thee under the sun , all the
days of thy vanity : for that is thy portion in this life , and in thy
labour which thou takest under the sun . </s>
<s> Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do , do it with thy might ; for
there is no work , nor device , nor knowledge , nor wisdom , in the grave ,
whither thou goest . </s>
<s> I returned , and saw under the sun , that the race is not to the
swift , nor the battle to the strong , neither yet bread to the wise ,
nor yet riches to men of understanding , nor yet favour to men of
skill ; but time and chance happeneth to them all . </s>
<s> For man also knoweth not his time : as the fishes that are taken
in an evil net , and as the birds that are caught in the snare ; so are
the sons of men snared in an evil time , when it falleth suddenly upon
them . </s>
<s> This wisdom have I seen also under the sun , and it seemed great
unto me : There was a little city , and few men within it ; and
there came a great king against it , and besieged it , and built great
bulwarks against it : Now there was found in it a poor wise man ,
and he by his wisdom delivered the city ; yet no man remembered that
same poor man . </s>
<s> Then said I , Wisdom is better than strength : nevertheless the
poor man 's wisdom is despised , and his words are not heard . </s>
<s> The words of wise men are heard in quiet more than the cry of him
that ruleth among fools . </s>
<s> Wisdom is better than weapons of war : but one sinner destroyeth
much good . </s>
<s> Dead flies cause the ointment of the apothecary to send forth a
stinking savour : so doth a little folly him that is in reputation for
wisdom and honour . </s>
<s> A wise man 's heart is at his right hand ; but a fool 's heart at
his left . </s>
<s> Yea also , when he that is a fool walketh by the way , his wisdom
faileth him , and he saith to every one that he is a fool . </s>
<s> If the spirit of the ruler rise up against thee , leave not thy
place ; for yielding pacifieth great offences . </s>
<s> There is an evil which I have seen under the sun , as an error
which proceedeth from the ruler : Folly is set in great dignity ,
and the rich sit in low place . </s>
<s> I have seen servants upon horses , and princes walking as servants
upon the earth . </s>
<s> He that diggeth a pit shall fall into it ; and whoso breaketh an
hedge , a serpent shall bite him . </s>
<s> Whoso removeth stones shall be hurt therewith ; and he that
cleaveth wood shall be endangered thereby . </s>
<s> If the iron be blunt , and he do not whet the edge , then must he
put to more strength : but wisdom is profitable to direct . </s>
<s> Surely the serpent will bite without enchantment ; and a babbler
is no better . </s>
<s> The words of a wise man 's mouth are gracious ; but the lips of a
fool will swallow up himself . </s>
<s> The beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness : and the
end of his talk is mischievous madness . </s>
<s> A fool also is full of words : a man cannot tell what shall be ;
and what shall be after him , who can tell him ? </s>
<s>  The labour of
the foolish wearieth every one of them , because he knoweth not how to
go to the city . </s>
<s> Woe to thee , O land , when thy king is a child , and thy princes
eat in the morning ! </s>
<s>  Blessed art thou , O land , when thy king is
the son of nobles , and thy princes eat in due season , for strength ,
and not for drunkenness ! </s>
<s>  By much slothfulness the building
decayeth ; and through idleness of the hands the house droppeth
through . </s>
<s> A feast is made for laughter , and wine maketh merry : but money
answereth all things . </s>
<s> Curse not the king , no not in thy thought ; and curse not the
rich in thy bedchamber : for a bird of the air shall carry the voice ,
and that which hath wings shall tell the matter . </s>
<s> Cast thy bread upon the waters : for thou shalt find it after many
days . </s>
<s> Give a portion to seven , and also to eight ; for thou knowest not
what evil shall be upon the earth . </s>
<s> If the clouds be full of rain , they empty themselves upon the
earth : and if the tree fall toward the south , or toward the north , in
the place where the tree falleth , there it shall be . </s>
<s> He that observeth the wind shall not sow ; and he that regardeth
the clouds shall not reap . </s>
<s> As thou knowest not what is the way of the spirit , nor how the
bones do grow in the womb of her that is with child : even so thou
knowest not the works of God who maketh all . </s>
<s> In the morning sow thy seed , and in the evening withhold not
thine hand : for thou knowest not whether shall prosper , either this or
that , or whether they both shall be alike good . </s>
<s> Truly the light is sweet , and a pleasant thing it is for the eyes
to behold the sun : But if a man live many years , and rejoice in
them all ; yet let him remember the days of darkness ; for they shall be
many . </s>
<s> All that cometh is vanity . </s>
<s> Rejoice , O young man , in thy youth ; and let thy heart cheer thee
in the days of thy youth , and walk in the ways of thine heart , and in
the sight of thine eyes : but know thou , that for all these things God
will bring thee into judgment . </s>
<s> Therefore remove sorrow from thy heart , and put away evil from
thy flesh : for childhood and youth are vanity . </s>
<s> Remember now thy Creator in the days of thy youth , while the evil
days come not , nor the years draw nigh , when thou shalt say , I have no
pleasure in them ; While the sun , or the light , or the moon , or
the stars , be not darkened , nor the clouds return after the rain : 
In the day when the keepers of the house shall tremble , and the strong
men shall bow themselves , and the grinders cease because they are few ,
and those that look out of the windows be darkened , And the doors
shall be shut in the streets , when the sound of the grinding is low ,
and he shall rise up at the voice of the bird , and all the daughters
of musick shall be brought low ; Also when they shall be afraid of
that which is high , and fears shall be in the way , and the almond tree
shall flourish , and the grasshopper shall be a burden , and desire
shall fail : because man goeth to his long home , and the mourners go
about the streets : Or ever the silver cord be loosed , or the
golden bowl be broken , or the pitcher be broken at the fountain , or
the wheel broken at the cistern . </s>
<s> Then shall the dust return to the earth as it was : and the spirit
shall return unto God who gave it . </s>
<s> Vanity of vanities , saith the preacher ; all is vanity . </s>
<s> And moreover , because the preacher was wise , he still taught the
people knowledge ; yea , he gave good heed , and sought out , and set in
order many proverbs . </s>
<s> The preacher sought to find out acceptable words : and that which
was written was upright , even words of truth . </s>
<s> The words of the wise are as goads , and as nails fastened by the
masters of assemblies , which are given from one shepherd . </s>
<s> And further , by these , my son , be admonished : of making many
books there is no end ; and much study is a weariness of the flesh . </s>
<s> Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter : Fear God , and
keep his commandments : for this is the whole duty of man . </s>
<s> For God shall bring every work into judgment , with every secret
thing , whether it be good , or whether it be evil . </s>

1 :1 The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz , which he saw concerning
Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah , Jotham , Ahaz , and Hezekiah ,
kings of Judah . </s>
<s> Hear , O heavens , and give ear , O earth : for the LORD hath spoken ,
I have nourished and brought up children , and they have rebelled
against me . </s>
<s> The ox knoweth his owner , and the ass his master 's crib : but
Israel doth not know , my people doth not consider . </s>
<s> Ah sinful nation , a people laden with iniquity , a seed of
evildoers , children that are corrupters : they have forsaken the LORD ,
they have provoked the Holy One of Israel unto anger , they are gone
away backward . </s>
<s> Why should ye be stricken any more ? </s>
<s> ye will revolt more and more :
the whole head is sick , and the whole heart faint . </s>
<s> From the sole of the foot even unto the head there is no soundness
in it ; but wounds , and bruises , and putrifying sores : they have not
been closed , neither bound up , neither mollified with ointment . </s>
<s> Your country is desolate , your cities are burned with fire : your
land , strangers devour it in your presence , and it is desolate , as
overthrown by strangers . </s>
<s> And the daughter of Zion is left as a cottage in a vineyard , as a
lodge in a garden of cucumbers , as a besieged city . </s>
<s> Except the LORD of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant , we
should have been as Sodom , and we should have been like unto Gomorrah . </s>
<s> Hear the word of the LORD , ye rulers of Sodom ; give ear unto the
law of our God , ye people of Gomorrah . </s>
<s> To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices unto me ? </s>
<s> the LORD : I am full of the burnt offerings of rams , and the fat
of fed beasts ; and I delight not in the blood of bullocks , or of
lambs , or of he goats . </s>
<s> When ye come to appear before me , who hath required this at your
hand , to tread my courts ? </s>
<s>  Bring no more vain oblations ; incense
is an abomination unto me ; the new moons and sabbaths , the calling of
assemblies , I cannot away with ; it is iniquity , even the solemn
meeting . </s>
<s> Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth : they are
a trouble unto me ; I am weary to bear them . </s>
<s> And when ye spread forth your hands , I will hide mine eyes from
you : yea , when ye make many prayers , I will not hear : your hands are
full of blood . </s>
<s> Wash you , make you clean ; put away the evil of your doings from

judgment , relieve the oppressed , judge the fatherless , plead for the
widow . </s>
<s> Come now , and let us reason together , saith the LORD : though your
sins be as scarlet , they shall be as white as snow ; though they be red
like crimson , they shall be as wool . </s>
<s> If ye be willing and obedient , ye shall eat the good of the land :
 But if ye refuse and rebel , ye shall be devoured with the sword :
for the mouth of the LORD hath spoken it . </s>
<s> How is the faithful city become an harlot ! </s>
<s> it was full of
judgment ; righteousness lodged in it ; but now murderers . </s>
<s> Thy silver is become dross , thy wine mixed with water : Thy
princes are rebellious , and companions of thieves : every one loveth

neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them . </s>
<s> Therefore saith the LORD , the LORD of hosts , the mighty One of
Israel , Ah , I will ease me of mine adversaries , and avenge me of mine
enemies : And I will turn my hand upon thee , and purely purge away
thy dross , and take away all thy tin : And I will restore thy
judges as at the first , and thy counsellors as at the beginning :
afterward thou shalt be called , The city of righteousness , the
faithful city . </s>
<s> Zion shall be redeemed with judgment , and her converts with
righteousness . </s>

<s> And the strong shall be as tow , and the maker of it as a spark ,

<s> 3 :1 For , behold , the Lord , the LORD of
hosts , doth take away from Jerusalem and from Judah the stay and the
staff , the whole stay of bread , and the whole stay of water . </s>
<s> The mighty man , and the man of war , the judge , and the prophet ,
and the prudent , and the ancient , 3 :3 The captain of fifty , and the
honourable man , and the counsellor , and the cunning artificer , and the
eloquent orator . </s>
<s> And I will give children to be their princes , and babes shall rule
over them . </s>
<s> And the people shall be oppressed , every one by another , and every
one by his neighbour : the child shall behave himself proudly against
the ancient , and the base against the honourable . </s>
<s> When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his
father , saying , Thou hast clothing , be thou our ruler , and let this
ruin be under thy hand : 3 :7 In that day shall he swear , saying , I will
not be an healer ; for in my house is neither bread nor clothing : make
me not a ruler of the people . </s>
<s> For Jerusalem is ruined , and Judah is fallen : because their tongue
and their doings are against the LORD , to provoke the eyes of his
glory . </s>
<s> The shew of their countenance doth witness against them ; and they
declare their sin as Sodom , they hide it not . </s>
<s> Woe unto their soul ! </s>
<s> for
they have rewarded evil unto themselves . </s>
<s> Say ye to the righteous , that it shall be well with him : for they
shall eat the fruit of their doings . </s>
<s> Woe unto the wicked ! </s>
<s> it shall be ill with him : for the reward of
his hands shall be given him . </s>
<s> As for my people , children are their oppressors , and women rule
over them . </s>
<s> O my people , they which lead thee cause thee to err , and
destroy the way of thy paths . </s>
<s> The LORD standeth up to plead , and standeth to judge the people . </s>
<s> The LORD will enter into judgment with the ancients of his
people , and the princes thereof : for ye have eaten up the vineyard ;
the spoil of the poor is in your houses . </s>
<s> What mean ye that ye beat my people to pieces , and grind the
faces of the poor ? </s>
<s> saith the Lord GOD of hosts . </s>
<s> Moreover the LORD saith , Because the daughters of Zion are
haughty , and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton eyes , walking
and mincing as they go , and making a tinkling with their feet : 
Therefore the LORD will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the
daughters of Zion , and the LORD will discover their secret parts . </s>
<s> In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling
ornaments about their feet , and their cauls , and their round tires
like the moon , The chains , and the bracelets , and the mufflers ,
 The bonnets , and the ornaments of the legs , and the headbands ,
and the tablets , and the earrings , The rings , and nose jewels ,
 The changeable suits of apparel , and the mantles , and the
wimples , and the crisping pins , The glasses , and the fine linen ,
and the hoods , and the vails . </s>
<s> And it shall come to pass , that instead of sweet smell there
shall be stink ; and instead of a girdle a rent ; and instead of well
set hair baldness ; and instead of a stomacher a girding of sackcloth ;
and burning instead of beauty . </s>
<s> Thy men shall fall by the sword , and thy mighty in the war . </s>
<s> And her gates shall lament and mourn ; and she being desolate
shall sit upon the ground . </s>
<s> And in that day seven women shall take hold of one man , saying , We
will eat our own bread , and wear our own apparel : only let us be
called by thy name , to take away our reproach . </s>
<s> In that day shall the branch of the LORD be beautiful and
glorious , and the fruit of the earth shall be excellent and comely for
them that are escaped of Israel . </s>
<s> And it shall come to pass , that he that is left in Zion , and he
that remaineth in Jerusalem , shall be called holy , even every one that
is written among the living in Jerusalem : 4 :4 When the Lord shall have
washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion , and shall have purged
the blood of Jerusalem from the midst thereof by the spirit of
judgment , and by the spirit of burning . </s>
<s> And the LORD will create upon every dwelling place of mount Zion ,
and upon her assemblies , a cloud and smoke by day , and the shining of
a flaming fire by night : for upon all the glory shall be a defence . </s>
<s> And there shall be a tabernacle for a shadow in the day time from
the heat , and for a place of refuge , and for a covert from storm and
from rain . </s>
<s> Now will I sing to my wellbeloved a song of my beloved touching
his vineyard . </s>
<s> My wellbeloved hath a vineyard in a very fruitful hill :
5 :2 And he fenced it , and gathered out the stones thereof , and planted
it with the choicest vine , and built a tower in the midst of it , and
also made a winepress therein : and he looked that it should bring
forth grapes , and it brought forth wild grapes . </s>
<s> And now , O inhabitants of Jerusalem , and men of Judah , judge , I
pray you , betwixt me and my vineyard . </s>
<s> What could have been done more to my vineyard , that I have not
done in it ? </s>
<s> wherefore , when I looked that it should bring forth
grapes , brought it forth wild grapes ? </s>
<s> 5 :5 And now go to ; I will tell
you what I will do to my vineyard : I will take away the hedge thereof ,
and it shall be eaten up ; and break down the wall thereof , and it

pruned , nor digged ; but there shall come up briers and thorns : I will
also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it . </s>
<s> For the vineyard of the LORD of hosts is the house of Israel , and

<s> Woe unto them that join house to house , that lay field to field ,

<s> 5 :9 In mine ears said the LORD of hosts , Of a truth many

<s> Yea , ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath , and the seed of

<s> Woe unto them that rise up early in the morning , that they may
follow strong drink ; that continue until night , till wine inflame
them ! </s>
<s>  And the harp , and the viol , the tabret , and pipe , and
