<s> Therefore my people are gone into captivity , because they have no
knowledge : and their honourable men are famished , and their multitude
dried up with thirst . </s>
<s> Therefore hell hath enlarged herself , and opened her mouth
without measure : and their glory , and their multitude , and their pomp ,
and he that rejoiceth , shall descend into it . </s>
<s> And the mean man shall be brought down , and the mighty man shall
be humbled , and the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled : But the
LORD of hosts shall be exalted in judgment , and God that is holy shall
be sanctified in righteousness . </s>
<s> Then shall the lambs feed after their manner , and the waste
places of the fat ones shall strangers eat . </s>
<s> Woe unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity , and sin as
it were with a cart rope : That say , Let him make speed , and
hasten his work , that we may see it : and let the counsel of the Holy
One of Israel draw nigh and come , that we may know it ! </s>
<s>  Woe unto
them that call evil good , and good evil ; that put darkness for light ,
and light for darkness ; that put bitter for sweet , and sweet for
bitter ! </s>
<s>  Woe unto them that are wise in their own eyes , and
prudent in their own sight ! </s>
<s>  Woe unto them that are mighty to
drink wine , and men of strength to mingle strong drink : Which
justify the wicked for reward , and take away the righteousness of the
righteous from him ! </s>
<s>  Therefore as the fire devoureth the stubble ,
and the flame consumeth the chaff , so their root shall be as
rottenness , and their blossom shall go up as dust : because they have
cast away the law of the LORD of hosts , and despised the word of the
Holy One of Israel . </s>
<s> Therefore is the anger of the LORD kindled against his people ,
and he hath stretched forth his hand against them , and hath smitten
them : and the hills did tremble , and their carcases were torn in the
midst of the streets . </s>
<s> all this his anger is not turned away , but his hand is stretched
out still . </s>
<s> And he will lift up an ensign to the nations from far , and will
hiss unto them from the end of the earth : and , behold , they shall come
with speed swiftly : None shall be weary nor stumble among them ;
none shall slumber nor sleep ; neither shall the girdle of their loins
be loosed , nor the latchet of their shoes be broken : Whose arrows
are sharp , and all their bows bent , their horses ' hoofs shall be
counted like flint , and their wheels like a whirlwind : Their
roaring shall be like a lion , they shall roar like young lions : yea ,
they shall roar , and lay hold of the prey , and shall carry it away
safe , and none shall deliver it . </s>
<s> And in that day they shall roar against them like the roaring of
the sea : and if one look unto the land , behold darkness and sorrow ,
and the light is darkened in the heavens thereof . </s>
<s> In the year that king Uzziah died I saw also the LORD sitting upon

<s> Above it stood the seraphims : each one had six wings ; with twain

<s> And one cried unto another , and said , Holy , holy , holy , is the
LORD of hosts : the whole earth is full of his glory . </s>
<s> And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried ,

<s> Then said I , Woe is me ! </s>
<s> for I am undone ; because I am a man of

<s> Then flew one of the seraphims unto me , having a live coal in his

<s> Also I heard the voice of the Lord , saying , Whom shall I send , and

<s> Then said I , Here am I ; send me . </s>

<s> Then said I , Lord , how long ? </s>
<s> And he answered , Until the cities be

<s> And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham , the son

<s> And it was told the house of David , saying , Syria is confederate

<s> And his heart was moved , and the heart of his people , as

<s> Because Syria , Ephraim , and the son of Remaliah , have taken evil

<s> And it shall come to pass in that day , that every place shall be ,

shall rest upon him , the spirit of wisdom and understanding , the
spirit of counsel and might , the spirit of knowledge and of the fear
of the LORD ; And shall make him of quick understanding in the
fear of the LORD : and he shall not judge after the sight of his eyes ,
neither reprove after the hearing of his ears : But with
righteousness shall he judge the poor , and reprove with equity for the
meek of the earth : and he shall smite the earth : with the rod of his
mouth , and with the breath of his lips shall he slay the wicked . </s>
<s> And righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins , and
faithfulness the girdle of his reins . </s>
<s> The wolf also shall dwell with the lamb , and the leopard shall
lie down with the kid ; and the calf and the young lion and the fatling
together ; and a little child shall lead them . </s>
<s> And the cow and the bear shall feed ; their young ones shall lie
down together : and the lion shall eat straw like the ox . </s>
<s> And the sucking child shall play on the hole of the asp , and the
weaned child shall put his hand on the cockatrice ' den . </s>
<s> They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain : for the

<s> And in that day there shall be a root of Jesse , which shall
stand for an ensign of the people ; to it shall the Gentiles seek : and
his rest shall be glorious . </s>
<s> And it shall come to pass in that day , that the Lord shall set

<s> And he shall set up an ensign for the nations , and shall

<s> But they shall fly upon the shoulders of the Philistines toward

<s> And the LORD shall utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian

<s> And in that day thou shalt say , O LORD , I will praise thee :

<s> Behold , God is my salvation ; I will trust , and not be afraid : for

<s> The burden of Babylon , which Isaiah the son of Amoz did see . </s>

<s> Therefore shall all hands be faint , and every man 's heart shall

be amazed one at another ; their faces shall be as flames . </s>
<s> Behold , the day of the LORD cometh , cruel both with wrath and

<s> For the stars of heaven and the constellations thereof shall not

<s> And I will punish the world for their evil , and the wicked for

<s> I will make a man more precious than fine gold ; even a man than

<s> Therefore I will shake the heavens , and the earth shall remove

<s> And it shall be as the chased roe , and as a sheep that no man

<s> And Babylon , the glory of kingdoms , the beauty of the Chaldees '

<s> And it shall come to pass in the day that the LORD shall give

<s>  All the kings of the nations , even all of them , lie

<s> The burden of Moab . </s>

<s> The burden of Egypt . </s>
<s> Behold , the LORD rideth upon a swift cloud ,

<s> And the Egyptians will I give over into the hand of a cruel lord ;

<s> The paper reeds by the brooks , by the mouth of the brooks , and

<s> The burden of the valley of vision . </s>
<s> What aileth thee now , that

<s>  Thou that art full of

<s> Therefore said I , Look away from me ; I will weep bitterly , labour

this word , and trust in oppression and perverseness , and stay thereon :

fall , swelling out in a high wall , whose breaking cometh suddenly at
an instant . </s>
<s> And he shall break it as the breaking of the potters ' vessel
that is broken in pieces ; he shall not spare : so that there shall not
be found in the bursting of it a sherd to take fire from the hearth ,
or to take water withal out of the pit . </s>
<s> For thus saith the Lord GOD , the Holy One of Israel ; In
returning and rest shall ye be saved ; in quietness and in confidence
shall be your strength : and ye would not . </s>
<s> But ye said , No ; for we will flee upon horses ; therefore shall
ye flee : and , We will ride upon the swift ; therefore shall they that
pursue you be swift . </s>
<s> One thousand shall flee at the rebuke of one ; at the rebuke of
five shall ye flee : till ye be left as a beacon upon the top of a
mountain , and as an ensign on an hill . </s>
<s> And therefore will the LORD wait , that he may be gracious unto
you , and therefore will he be exalted , that he may have mercy upon
you : for the LORD is a God of judgment : blessed are all they that wait
for him . </s>
<s> For the people shall dwell in Zion at Jerusalem : thou shalt weep
no more : he will be very gracious unto thee at the voice of thy cry ;
when he shall hear it , he will answer thee . </s>
<s> And though the Lord give you the bread of adversity , and the
water of affliction , yet shall not thy teachers be removed into a

walk ye in it , when ye turn to the right hand , and when ye turn to the
left . </s>
<s> Ye shall defile also the covering of thy graven images of

<s> Then shall he give the rain of thy seed , that thou shalt sow the

<s> The oxen likewise and the young asses that ear the ground shall

<s> And there shall be upon every high mountain , and upon every high

<s> Moreover the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun ,
and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold , as the light of seven

<s> Behold , the name of the LORD cometh from far , burning with his

in the jaws of the people , causing them to err . </s>
<s> Ye shall have a song , as in the night when a holy solemnity is

<s> And the LORD shall cause his glorious voice to be heard , and

<s> For through the voice of the LORD shall the Assyrian be beaten
down , which smote with a rod . </s>
<s> And in every place where the grounded staff shall pass , which

<s> For Tophet is ordained of old ; yea , for the king it is prepared ;

<s> Woe to them that go down to Egypt for help ; and stay on horses ,

<s>  Yet he also is wise , and will bring evil ,
and will not call back his words : but will arise against the house of

<s> Now the Egyptians are men , and not God ; and their horses flesh ,

<s> When the LORD shall stretch out his hand , both he that
helpeth shall fall , and he that is holpen shall fall down , and they

<s> For thus hath the LORD spoken unto me , Like as the lion and the

down to fight for mount Zion , and for the hill thereof . </s>
<s> As birds flying , so will the LORD of hosts defend Jerusalem ;

<s> Turn ye unto him from whom the children of Israel have deeply

<s> For in that day every man shall cast away his idols of silver ,

<s> Then shall the Assyrian fall with the sword , not of a mighty man ;

<s> And he shall pass over to his strong hold for fear , and his

<s> Behold , a king shall reign in righteousness , and princes shall

<s> And a man shall be as an hiding place from the wind , and a covert

<s> And the eyes of them that see shall not be dim , and the ears of

<s> The heart also of the rash shall understand knowledge , and the
tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly . </s>
<s> The vile person shall be no more called liberal , nor the churl

<s> For the vile person will speak villany , and his heart will work
iniquity , to practise hypocrisy , and to utter error against the LORD ,
to make empty the soul of the hungry , and he will cause the drink of
the thirsty to fail . </s>
<s> The instruments also of the churl are evil : he deviseth wicked
devices to destroy the poor with lying words , even when the needy
speaketh right . </s>
<s> But the liberal deviseth liberal things ; and by liberal things
shall he stand . </s>
<s> Rise up , ye women that are at ease ; hear my voice , ye careless

<s> Many days and years shall ye be troubled , ye careless women : for

<s> Tremble , ye women that are at ease ; be troubled , ye careless

<s> They shall lament for the teats , for the pleasant fields , for

<s> Upon the land of my people shall come up thorns and briers ; yea ,

the forts and towers shall be for dens for ever , a joy of wild asses ,
a pasture of flocks ; Until the spirit be poured upon us from on
high , and the wilderness be a fruitful field , and the fruitful field
be counted for a forest . </s>
<s> Then judgment shall dwell in the wilderness , and righteousness
remain in the fruitful field . </s>
<s> And the work of righteousness shall be peace ; and the effect of
righteousness quietness and assurance for ever . </s>
<s> And my people shall dwell in a peaceable habitation , and in sure
dwellings , and in quiet resting places ; When it shall hail ,
coming down on the forest ; and the city shall be low in a low place . </s>
<s> Blessed are ye that sow beside all waters , that send forth
thither the feet of the ox and the ass . </s>
<s> Woe to thee that spoilest , and thou wast not spoiled ; and dealest
treacherously , and they dealt not treacherously with thee ! </s>
<s> when thou
shalt cease to spoil , thou shalt be spoiled ; and when thou shalt make

<s> O LORD , be gracious unto us ; we have waited for thee : be thou

<s> And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the

<s> The LORD is exalted ; for he dwelleth on high : he hath filled Zion

<s> And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times , and

<s> The highways lie waste , the wayfaring man ceaseth : he hath broken

<s> Now will I rise , saith the LORD ; now will I be exalted ; now will

<s> Ye shall conceive chaff , ye shall bring forth stubble : your

<s> The sinners in Zion are afraid ; fearfulness hath surprised the

<s> Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire ? </s>
<s> who

<s>  He that walketh
righteously , and speaketh uprightly ; he that despiseth the gain of

<s> Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty : they shall behold

<s> where is
the receiver ? </s>

<s> But there the glorious LORD will be unto us a place of broad

<s> And all the host of heaven shall be dissolved , and the heavens

<s> For my sword shall be bathed in heaven : behold , it shall come

<s> And the unicorns shall come down with them , and the bullocks with

<s> For it is the day of the LORD 's vengeance , and the year of

<s> And the streams thereof shall be turned into pitch , and the dust

<s> It shall not be quenched night nor day ; the smoke thereof shall

<s> But the cormorant and the bittern shall possess it ; the owl also

<s> They shall call the nobles thereof to the kingdom , but none
shall be there , and all her princes shall be nothing . </s>
<s> And thorns shall come up in her palaces , nettles and brambles in

<s> The wild beasts of the desert shall also meet with the wild

<s> There shall the great owl make her nest , and lay , and hatch , and

<s> Seek ye out of the book of the LORD , and read : no one of these

<s> And he hath cast the lot for them , and his hand hath divided it

<s> The wilderness and the solitary place shall be glad for them ; and

<s> It shall blossom abundantly , and rejoice even with joy and

<s> Strengthen ye the weak hands , and confirm the feeble knees . </s>
<s> Say to them that are of a fearful heart , Be strong , fear not :

<s> Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened , and the ears of the

<s> Then shall the lame man leap as an hart , and the tongue of the

in the desert . </s>
<s> And the parched ground shall become a pool , and the thirsty land
springs of water : in the habitation of dragons , where each lay , shall

<s> And an highway shall be there , and a way , and it shall be called
The way of holiness ; the unclean shall not pass over it ; but it shall

<s> No lion shall be there , nor any ravenous beast shall go up

<s> Now it came to pass in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah , that

<s> And he stood by the conduit of
the upper pool in the highway of the fuller 's field . </s>
<s> Then came forth unto him Eliakim , Hilkiah 's son , which was over

<s> And Rabshakeh said unto them , Say ye now to Hezekiah , Thus saith

<s>  I say , sayest thou , (but they are but vain words)
I have counsel and strength for war : now on whom dost thou trust , that
thou rebellest against me ? </s>
<s>  Lo , thou trustest in the staff of
this broken reed , on Egypt ; whereon if a man lean , it will go into his

<s> But if thou say to me , We trust in the LORD our God : is it not

this land to destroy it ? </s>
<s> the LORD said unto me , Go up against this

<s> And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah shall

<s> Therefore thus saith the LORD concerning the king of Assyria , He

<s> For I will defend this city to save it for mine own sake , and

<s> So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed , and went and returned ,

<s> In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death . </s>
<s> And Isaiah the
prophet the son of Amoz came unto him , and said unto him , Thus saith

<s> Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall , and prayed unto
the LORD , And said , Remember now , O LORD , I beseech thee , how I
have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart , and have
done that which is good in thy sight . </s>
<s> And Hezekiah wept sore . </s>
<s> Then came the word of the LORD to Isaiah , saying , Go , and
say to Hezekiah , Thus saith the LORD , the God of David thy father , I
have heard thy prayer , I have seen thy tears : behold , I will add unto
thy days fifteen years . </s>
<s> And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king
of Assyria : and I will defend this city . </s>
<s> And this shall be a sign unto thee from the LORD , that the LORD
will do this thing that he hath spoken ; Behold , I will bring
again the shadow of the degrees , which is gone down in the sun dial of
Ahaz , ten degrees backward . </s>
<s> So the sun returned ten degrees , by which
degrees it was gone down . </s>
<s> The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah , when he had been sick , and
was recovered of his sickness : I said in the cutting off of my
days , I shall go to the gates of the grave : I am deprived of the
residue of my years . </s>
<s> I said , I shall not see the LORD , even the LORD , in the land of
the living : I shall behold man no more with the inhabitants of the
world . </s>
<s> Mine age is departed , and is removed from me as a shepherd 's
tent : I have cut off like a weaver my life : he will cut me off with
pining sickness : from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me . </s>
<s> I reckoned till morning , that , as a lion , so will he break all
my bones : from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me . </s>
<s> Like a crane or a swallow , so did I chatter : I did mourn as a
dove : mine eyes fail with looking upward : O LORD , I am oppressed ;
undertake for me . </s>
<s> What shall I say ? </s>
<s> he hath both spoken unto me , and himself hath
done it : I shall go softly all my years in the bitterness of my soul . </s>
<s> O LORD , by these things men live , and in all these things is the
life of my spirit : so wilt thou recover me , and make me to live . </s>
<s> Behold , for peace I had great bitterness : but thou hast in love
to my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption : for thou hast cast
all my sins behind thy back . </s>
<s> For the grave cannot praise thee , death can not celebrate thee :
they that go down into the pit cannot hope for thy truth . </s>
<s> The living , the living , he shall praise thee , as I do this day :
the father to the children shall make known thy truth . </s>
<s> The LORD was ready to save me : therefore we will sing my songs
to the stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of
the LORD . </s>
<s> For Isaiah had said , Let them take a lump of figs , and lay it
for a plaister upon the boil , and he shall recover . </s>
<s> Hezekiah also had said , What is the sign that I shall go up to
the house of the LORD ? </s>
<s>  At that time Merodachbaladan , the son of
Baladan , king of Babylon , sent letters and a present to Hezekiah : for
he had heard that he had been sick , and was recovered . </s>
<s> And Hezekiah was glad of them , and shewed them the house of his
precious things , the silver , and the gold , and the spices , and the
precious ointment , and all the house of his armour , and all that was
found in his treasures : there was nothing in his house , nor in all his
dominion , that Hezekiah shewed them not . </s>
<s> Then came Isaiah the prophet unto king Hezekiah , and said unto

<s> and from whence came they unto thee ? </s>
<s> And

<s> Then said he , What have they seen in thine house ? </s>
<s> And Hezekiah
answered , All that is in mine house have they seen : there is nothing
among my treasures that I have not shewed them . </s>
<s> Then said Isaiah to Hezekiah , Hear the word of the LORD of hosts :
 Behold , the days come , that all that is in thine house , and that

<s> And of thy sons that shall issue from thee , which thou shalt

<s> Then said Hezekiah to Isaiah , Good is the word of the LORD which

<s> He said moreover , For there shall be peace and truth
in my days . </s>
<s> Comfort ye , comfort ye my people , saith your God . </s>
<s> Speak ye comfortably to Jerusalem , and cry unto her , that her
warfare is accomplished , that her iniquity is pardoned : for she hath
received of the LORD 's hand double for all her sins . </s>
<s> The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness , Prepare ye the

<s> Every valley shall be exalted , and every mountain and hill shall

all flesh shall see it together : for the mouth of the LORD hath spoken
it . </s>
<s> The voice said , Cry . </s>
<s> And he said , What shall I cry ? </s>
<s> All flesh is
grass , and all the goodliness thereof is as the flower of the field :
 The grass withereth , the flower fadeth : because the spirit of the
LORD bloweth upon it : surely the people is grass . </s>
<s> The grass withereth , the flower fadeth : but the word of our God
shall stand for ever . </s>
<s> O Zion , that bringest good tidings , get thee up into the high

<s>  Behold , the Lord GOD will come with
strong hand , and his arm shall rule for him : behold , his reward is

<s> He shall feed his flock like a shepherd : he shall gather the

<s> Who hath measured the waters in the hollow of his hand , and

<s>  Who hath directed the Spirit of the LORD , or being his

<s>  With whom took he counsel , and who

the nations are as a drop of a bucket , and are counted as the small

<s> And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn , nor the beasts thereof
sufficient for a burnt offering . </s>
<s> All nations before him are as nothing ; and they are counted to

<s> or what likeness will ye compare
unto him ? </s>
<s>  The workman melteth a graven image , and the goldsmith

<s> He that is so impoverished that he hath no oblation chooseth a
tree that will not rot ; he seeketh unto him a cunning workman to

<s> Have ye not known ? </s>
<s> have ye not heard ? </s>
<s> hath it not been told you
from the beginning ? </s>
<s> have ye not understood from the foundations of the

<s>  It is he that sitteth upon the circle of the earth , and
the inhabitants thereof are as grasshoppers ; that stretcheth out the
heavens as a curtain , and spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in :
 That bringeth the princes to nothing ; he maketh the judges of
the earth as vanity . </s>
<s> Yea , they shall not be planted ; yea , they shall not be sown :
yea , their stock shall not take root in the earth : and he shall also
blow upon them , and they shall wither , and the whirlwind shall take

<s> To whom then will ye liken me , or shall I be equal ? </s>
<s> saith the
Holy One . </s>
<s> Lift up your eyes on high , and behold who hath created these
things , that bringeth out their host by number : he calleth them all by
names by the greatness of his might , for that he is strong in power ;
not one faileth . </s>
<s> Why sayest thou , O Jacob , and speakest , O Israel , My way is hid
from the LORD , and my judgment is passed over from my God ? </s>
<s>  Hast
thou not known ? </s>
<s> hast thou not heard , that the everlasting God , the
LORD , the Creator of the ends of the earth , fainteth not , neither is
weary ? </s>
<s> there is no searching of his understanding . </s>
<s> He giveth power to the faint ; and to them that have no might he
increaseth strength . </s>
<s> Even the youths shall faint and be weary , and the young men
shall utterly fall : But they that wait upon the LORD shall renew
their strength ; they shall mount up with wings as eagles ; they shall
run , and not be weary ; and they shall walk , and not faint . </s>
<s> Keep silence before me , O islands ; and let the people renew their
strength : let them come near ; then let them speak : let us come near
together to judgment . </s>
<s> Who raised up the righteous man from the east , called him to his
foot , gave the nations before him , and made him rule over kings ? </s>
<s> he
gave them as the dust to his sword , and as driven stubble to his bow . </s>
<s> He pursued them , and passed safely ; even by the way that he had
not gone with his feet . </s>
<s> Who hath wrought and done it , calling the generations from the
beginning ? </s>
<s> I the LORD , the first , and with the last ; I am he . </s>
<s> The isles saw it , and feared ; the ends of the earth were afraid ,
drew near , and came . </s>
<s> They helped every one his neighbour ; and every one said to his
brother , Be of good courage . </s>
<s> So the carpenter encouraged the goldsmith , and he that smootheth
with the hammer him that smote the anvil , saying , It is ready for the
sodering : and he fastened it with nails , that it should not be moved . </s>
<s> But thou , Israel , art my servant , Jacob whom I have chosen , the

<s> Thou whom I have taken from the ends of the earth , and called

<s> Fear thou not ; for I am with thee : be not dismayed ; for I am thy

<s> Behold , all they that were incensed against thee shall be

<s> Thou shalt seek them , and shalt not find them , even them that
contended with thee : they that war against thee shall be as nothing ,

<s> For I the LORD thy God will hold thy right hand , saying unto

<s> Fear not , thou worm Jacob , and ye men of Israel ; I will help

<s> Behold , I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having

<s> Thou shalt fan them , and the wind shall carry them away , and the

<s> When the poor and needy seek water , and there is none , and their

<s> I will open rivers in high places , and fountains in the midst of

<s> I will plant in the wilderness the cedar , the shittah tree , and

hath done this , and the Holy One of Israel hath created it . </s>
<s> Produce your cause , saith the LORD ; bring forth your strong

<s> Let them bring them forth , and shew us what shall happen : let

<s> Shew the things that are to come hereafter , that we may know

<s> Behold , ye are of nothing , and your work of nought : an

<s> I have raised up one from the north , and he shall come : from the

<s> and

<s> The first shall say to Zion , Behold , behold them : and I will

<s> For I beheld , and there was no man ; even among them , and there

<s> Behold , they are all vanity ; their works are nothing : their

<s> Behold my servant , whom I uphold ; mine elect , in whom my soul

<s> He shall not cry , nor lift up , nor cause his voice to be heard in

<s> A bruised reed shall he not break , and the smoking flax shall he

<s> He shall not fail nor be discouraged , till he have set judgment
in the earth : and the isles shall wait for his law . </s>
<s> Thus saith God the LORD , he that created the heavens , and

<s> I am the LORD : that is my name : and my glory will I not give to

<s> The LORD shall go forth as a mighty man , he shall stir up

<s> I have long time holden my peace ; I have been still , and

<s> The smith with the tongs both worketh in the coals , and

<s> The carpenter stretcheth out his rule ; he marketh it out with a

<s> He heweth him down cedars , and taketh the cypress and the oak ,

<s> Then shall it be for a man to burn : for he will take thereof ,

<s> He burneth part thereof in the fire ; with part thereof he eateth

<s> They have not known nor understood : for he hath shut their eyes ,

<s> I fall down to the stock of a tree ? </s>
<s>  He feedeth on ashes :
a deceived heart hath turned him aside , that he cannot deliver his

these , O Jacob and Israel ; for thou art my servant : I have formed

<s> Thus saith the LORD , thy redeemer , and he that formed thee from

 That confirmeth the word of his servant , and performeth the

raise up the decayed places thereof : That saith to the deep , Be

<s> Thus saith the LORD to his anointed , to Cyrus , whose right hand I
have holden , to subdue nations before him ; and I will loose the loins
of kings , to open before him the two leaved gates ; and the gates shall
not be shut ; I will go before thee , and make the crooked places
straight : I will break in pieces the gates of brass , and cut in sunder
the bars of iron : And I will give thee the treasures of darkness ,
and hidden riches of secret places , that thou mayest know that I , the
LORD , which call thee by thy name , am the God of Israel . </s>
<s> For Jacob my servant 's sake , and Israel mine elect , I have even
called thee by thy name : I have surnamed thee , though thou hast not
known me . </s>
<s> I am the LORD , and there is none else , there is no God beside me :
I girded thee , though thou hast not known me : That they may know
from the rising of the sun , and from the west , that there is none
beside me . </s>
<s> I am the LORD , and there is none else . </s>
<s> I form the light , and create darkness : I make peace , and create
evil : I the LORD do all these things . </s>
<s> Drop down , ye heavens , from above , and let the skies pour down
righteousness : let the earth open , and let them bring forth salvation ,
and let righteousness spring up together ; I the LORD have created it . </s>
<s> Woe unto him that striveth with his Maker ! </s>
<s> Let the potsherd
strive with the potsherds of the earth . </s>
<s> Shall the clay say to him that
fashioneth it , What makest thou ? </s>
<s> or thy work , He hath no hands ? </s>
<s> 
Woe unto him that saith unto his father , What begettest thou ? </s>
<s> or to
the woman , What hast thou brought forth ? </s>
<s>  Thus saith the LORD ,
the Holy One of Israel , and his Maker , Ask me of things to come
concerning my sons , and concerning the work of my hands command ye me . </s>
<s> I have made the earth , and created man upon it : I , even my
hands , have stretched out the heavens , and all their host have I
commanded . </s>
<s> I have raised him up in righteousness , and I will direct all his
ways : he shall build my city , and he shall let go my captives , not for
price nor reward , saith the LORD of hosts . </s>
<s> Thus saith the LORD , The labour of Egypt , and merchandise of
Ethiopia and of the Sabeans , men of stature , shall come over unto

they shall come over , and they shall fall down unto thee , they shall
make supplication unto thee , saying , Surely God is in thee ; and there
is none else , there is no God . </s>
<s> Verily thou art a God that hidest thyself , O God of Israel , the
Saviour . </s>
<s> They shall be ashamed , and also confounded , all of them : they
shall go to confusion together that are makers of idols . </s>
<s> But Israel shall be saved in the LORD with an everlasting
salvation : ye shall not be ashamed nor confounded world without end . </s>
<s> For thus saith the LORD that created the heavens ; God himself
that formed the earth and made it ; he hath established it , he created
it not in vain , he formed it to be inhabited : I am the LORD ; and there
is none else . </s>
<s> I have not spoken in secret , in a dark place of the earth : I
said not unto the seed of Jacob , Seek ye me in vain : I the LORD speak
righteousness , I declare things that are right . </s>
<s> Assemble yourselves and come ; draw near together , ye that are
escaped of the nations : they have no knowledge that set up the wood of
their graven image , and pray unto a god that cannot save . </s>
<s> Tell ye , and bring them near ; yea , let them take counsel
together : who hath declared this from ancient time ? </s>
<s> who hath told it
from that time ? </s>
<s> have not I the LORD ? </s>
<s> and there is no God else beside
me ; a just God and a Saviour ; there is none beside me . </s>
<s> Look unto me , and be ye saved , all the ends of the earth : for I
am God , and there is none else . </s>
<s> I have sworn by myself , the word is gone out of my mouth in
righteousness , and shall not return , That unto me every knee shall
bow , every tongue shall swear . </s>
<s> Surely , shall one say , in the LORD have I righteousness and
strength : even to him shall men come ; and all that are incensed
against him shall be ashamed . </s>
<s> In the LORD shall all the seed of Israel be justified , and shall
glory . </s>
<s> Bel boweth down , Nebo stoopeth , their idols were upon the beasts ,
and upon the cattle : your carriages were heavy loaden ; they are a
burden to the weary beast . </s>
<s> They stoop , they bow down together ; they could not deliver the
burden , but themselves are gone into captivity . </s>
<s> Hearken unto me , O house of Jacob , and all the remnant of the
house of Israel , which are borne by me from the belly , which are
carried from the womb : And even to your old age I am he ; and even
to hoar hairs will I carry you : I have made , and I will bear ; even I
will carry , and will deliver you . </s>
<s> To whom will ye liken me , and make me equal , and compare me , that
we may be like ? </s>
<s>  They lavish gold out of the bag , and weigh
silver in the balance , and hire a goldsmith ; and he maketh it a god :
they fall down , yea , they worship . </s>
<s> They bear him upon the shoulder , they carry him , and set him in
his place , and he standeth ; from his place shall he not remove : yea ,
one shall cry unto him , yet can he not answer , nor save him out of his
trouble . </s>
<s> Remember this , and shew yourselves men : bring it again to mind , O
ye transgressors . </s>
<s> Remember the former things of old : for I am God , and there is
none else ; I am God , and there is none like me , Declaring the
end from the beginning , and from ancient times the things that are not
yet done , saying , My counsel shall stand , and I will do all my
pleasure : Calling a ravenous bird from the east , the man that
executeth my counsel from a far country : yea , I have spoken it , I will
also bring it to pass ; I have purposed it , I will also do it . </s>
<s> Hearken unto me , ye stouthearted , that are far from
righteousness : I bring near my righteousness ; it shall not be
far off , and my salvation shall not tarry : and I will place salvation
in Zion for Israel my glory . </s>
<s> Come down , and sit in the dust , O virgin daughter of Babylon , sit
on the ground : there is no throne , O daughter of the Chaldeans : for
thou shalt no more be called tender and delicate . </s>
<s> Take the millstones , and grind meal : uncover thy locks , make bare
the leg , uncover the thigh , pass over the rivers . </s>
<s> Thy nakedness shall be uncovered , yea , thy shame shall be seen : I
will take vengeance , and I will not meet thee as a man . </s>
<s> As for our redeemer , the LORD of hosts is his name , the Holy One
of Israel . </s>
<s> Sit thou silent , and get thee into darkness , O daughter of the
Chaldeans : for thou shalt no more be called , The lady of kingdoms . </s>
<s> I was wroth with my people , I have polluted mine inheritance , and
given them into thine hand : thou didst shew them no mercy ; upon the
ancient hast thou very heavily laid thy yoke . </s>
<s> And thou saidst , I shall be a lady for ever : so that thou didst
not lay these things to thy heart , neither didst remember the latter
end of it . </s>
<s> Therefore hear now this , thou that art given to pleasures , that
dwellest carelessly , that sayest in thine heart , I am , and none else
beside me ; I shall not sit as a widow , neither shall I know the loss
of children : But these two things shall come to thee in a moment
in one day , the loss of children , and widowhood : they shall come upon
thee in their perfection for the multitude of thy sorceries , and for
the great abundance of thine enchantments . </s>
<s> For thou hast trusted in thy wickedness : thou hast said , None
seeth me . </s>
<s> Thy wisdom and thy knowledge , it hath perverted thee ; and
thou hast said in thine heart , I am , and none else beside me . </s>
<s> Therefore shall evil come upon thee ; thou shalt not know from
whence it riseth : and mischief shall fall upon thee ; thou shalt not be
able to put it off : and desolation shall come upon thee suddenly ,
which thou shalt not know . </s>
<s> Stand now with thine enchantments , and with the multitude of thy
sorceries , wherein thou hast laboured from thy youth ; if so be thou
shalt be able to profit , if so be thou mayest prevail . </s>
<s> Thou art wearied in the multitude of thy counsels . </s>
<s> Let now the
astrologers , the stargazers , the monthly prognosticators , stand up ,
and save thee from these things that shall come upon thee . </s>
<s> Behold , they shall be as stubble ; the fire shall burn them ; they
shall not deliver themselves from the power of the flame : there shall
not be a coal to warm at , nor fire to sit before it . </s>
<s> Thus shall they be unto thee with whom thou hast laboured , even
thy merchants , from thy youth : they shall wander every one to his
quarter ; none shall save thee . </s>
<s> Hear ye this , O house of Jacob , which are called by the name of
Israel , and are come forth out of the waters of Judah , which swear by
the name of the LORD , and make mention of the God of Israel , but not
in truth , nor in righteousness . </s>
<s> For they call themselves of the holy city , and stay themselves
upon the God of Israel ; The LORD of hosts is his name . </s>
<s> I have declared the former things from the beginning ; and they
went forth out of my mouth , and I shewed them ; I did them suddenly ,
and they came to pass . </s>
<s> Because I knew that thou art obstinate , and thy neck is an iron
sinew , and thy brow brass ; I have even from the beginning
declared it to thee ; before it came to pass I shewed it thee : lest
thou shouldest say , Mine idol hath done them , and my graven image , and
my molten image , hath commanded them . </s>
<s> Thou hast heard , see all this ; and will not ye declare it ? </s>
<s> I have
shewed thee new things from this time , even hidden things , and thou
didst not know them . </s>
<s> They are created now , and not from the beginning ; even before the
day when thou heardest them not ; lest thou shouldest say , Behold , I
knew them . </s>
<s> Yea , thou heardest not ; yea , thou knewest not ; yea , from that
time that thine ear was not opened : for I knew that thou wouldest deal
very treacherously , and wast called a transgressor from the womb . </s>
<s> For my name 's sake will I defer mine anger , and for my praise
will I refrain for thee , that I cut thee not off . </s>
<s> Behold , I have refined thee , but not with silver ; I have chosen
thee in the furnace of affliction . </s>
<s> For mine own sake , even for mine own sake , will I do it : for how
should my name be polluted ? </s>
<s> and I will not give my glory unto another . </s>
<s> Hearken unto me , O Jacob and Israel , my called ; I am he ; I am
the first , I also am the last . </s>
<s> Mine hand also hath laid the foundation of the earth , and my
right hand hath spanned the heavens : when I call unto them , they stand

<s> All ye , assemble yourselves , and hear ; which among them hath
declared these things ? </s>
<s> The LORD hath loved him : he will do his
pleasure on Babylon , and his arm shall be on the Chaldeans . </s>
<s> I , even I , have spoken ; yea , I have called him : I have brought
him , and he shall make his way prosperous . </s>
<s> Come ye near unto me , hear ye this ; I have not spoken in secret
from the beginning ; from the time that it was , there am I : and now the
Lord GOD , and his Spirit , hath sent me . </s>
<s> Thus saith the LORD , thy Redeemer , the Holy One of Israel ; I am
the LORD thy God which teacheth thee to profit , which leadeth thee by
the way that thou shouldest go . </s>
<s> O that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments ! </s>
<s> then had thy
peace been as a river , and thy righteousness as the waves of the sea :
 Thy seed also had been as the sand , and the offspring of thy
bowels like the gravel thereof ; his name should not have been cut off
nor destroyed from before me . </s>
<s> Go ye forth of Babylon , flee ye from the Chaldeans , with a voice

<s> And they thirsted not when he led them through the deserts : he

<s> There is no peace , saith the LORD , unto the wicked . </s>
<s> Listen , O isles , unto me ; and hearken , ye people , from far ; The
LORD hath called me from the womb ; from the bowels of my mother hath
he made mention of my name . </s>
<s> And he hath made my mouth like a sharp sword ; in the shadow of

<s> Then I said , I have laboured in vain , I have spent my strength

<s> And now , saith the LORD that formed me from the womb to be his

<s> And he said , It is a light thing that thou shouldest be my
servant to raise up the tribes of Jacob , and to restore the preserved

<s> Thus saith the LORD , the Redeemer of Israel , and his Holy One , to

<s> Thus saith the LORD , In an acceptable time have I heard thee , and

cause to inherit the desolate heritages ; That thou mayest say to

<s> They shall feed in the ways , and their pastures shall be
in all high places . </s>
<s> They shall not hunger nor thirst ; neither shall the heat nor sun

<s> And I will make all my mountains a way , and my highways shall be

<s> Behold , these shall come from far : and , lo , these from the north

<s> Sing , O heavens ; and be joyful , O earth ; and break forth into

<s> But Zion said , The LORD hath forsaken me , and my Lord hath

<s> Can a woman forget her sucking child , that she should not have
compassion on the son of her womb ? </s>
<s> yea , they may forget , yet will I
not forget thee . </s>
<s> Behold , I have graven thee upon the palms of my hands ; thy walls
are continually before me . </s>
<s> Thy children shall make haste ; thy destroyers and they that made

<s> Lift up thine eyes round about , and behold : all these gather

<s> As I live , saith the LORD , thou

<s> For thy waste and thy desolate places , and the land of thy

<s> The children which thou shalt have , after thou hast lost the

<s> Then shalt thou say in thine heart , Who hath begotten me these ,

<s> and who hath brought up these ? </s>
<s> Behold , I was left

<s>  Thus saith the Lord GOD ,
Behold , I will lift up mine hand to the Gentiles , and set up my

<s> And kings shall be thy nursing fathers , and their queens thy

<s> Shall the prey be taken from the mighty , or the lawful captive
delivered ? </s>
<s>  But thus saith the LORD , Even the captives of the
mighty shall be taken away , and the prey of the terrible shall be

I will save thy children . </s>
<s> And I will feed them that oppress thee with their own flesh ; and
they shall be drunken with their own blood , as with sweet wine : and

the mighty One of Jacob . </s>
<s> Thus saith the LORD , Where is the bill of your mother 's

<s> or which of my creditors is it to
whom I have sold you ? </s>
<s> Behold , for your iniquities have ye sold

<s> Wherefore , when I came , was there no man ? </s>
<s> when I called , was
there none to answer ? </s>
<s> Is my hand shortened at all , that it cannot

<s> or have I no power to deliver ? </s>
<s> behold , at my rebuke I dry up

<s> I clothe the heavens with blackness , and I make sackcloth their

<s> The Lord GOD hath given me the tongue of the learned , that I
should know how to speak a word in season to him that is weary : he
wakeneth morning by morning , he wakeneth mine ear to hear as the

<s> The Lord GOD hath opened mine ear , and I was not rebellious ,

<s> I gave my back to the smiters , and my cheeks to them that plucked
off the hair : I hid not my face from shame and spitting . </s>
<s> For the Lord GOD will help me ; therefore shall I not be
confounded : therefore have I set my face like a flint , and I know that
I shall not be ashamed . </s>
<s> He is near that justifieth me ; who will contend with me ? </s>
<s> let us
stand together : who is mine adversary ? </s>
<s> let him come near to me . </s>
<s> Behold , the Lord GOD will help me ; who is he that shall condemn

<s> lo , they all shall wax old as a garment ; the moth shall eat them

<s> Who is among you that feareth the LORD , that obeyeth the voice
of his servant , that walketh in darkness , and hath no light ? </s>
<s> let him
trust in the name of the LORD , and stay upon his God . </s>
<s> Behold , all ye that kindle a fire , that compass yourselves about

<s> This shall ye have of mine hand ; ye shall lie down in

<s> Hearken to me , ye that follow after righteousness , ye that seek

<s> Look unto Abraham your father , and unto Sarah that bare you : for

<s> For the LORD shall comfort Zion : he will comfort all her waste

<s> Hearken unto me , my people ; and give ear unto me , O my nation :

<s> My righteousness is near ; my salvation is gone forth , and mine

<s> Lift up your eyes to the heavens , and look upon the earth
beneath : for the heavens shall vanish away like smoke , and the earth

<s> Hearken unto me , ye that know righteousness , the people in whose

<s> For the moth shall eat them up like a garment , and the worm shall

<s> Awake , awake , put on strength , O arm of the LORD ; awake , as in

<s> Art thou not it that hath
cut Rahab , and wounded the dragon ? </s>
<s>  Art thou not it which hath
dried the sea , the waters of the great deep ; that hath made the depths

<s>  Therefore the
redeemed of the LORD shall return , and come with singing unto Zion ;

<s> I , even I , am he that comforteth you : who art thou , that thou

earth ; and hast feared continually every day because of the fury of

<s> and where is the fury
of the oppressor ? </s>
<s>  The captive exile hasteneth that he may be
loosed , and that he should not die in the pit , nor that his bread

<s> But I am the LORD thy God , that divided the sea , whose waves

<s> And I have put my words in thy mouth , and I have covered thee in

<s> Awake , awake , stand up , O Jerusalem , which hast drunk at the

<s> There is none to guide her among all the sons whom she hath
brought forth ; neither is there any that taketh her by the hand of all

<s> These two things are come unto thee ; who shall be sorry for
thee ? </s>
<s> desolation , and destruction , and the famine , and the sword : by
whom shall I comfort thee ? </s>
<s>  Thy sons have fainted , they lie at
the head of all the streets , as a wild bull in a net : they are full of

<s> Therefore hear now this , thou afflicted , and drunken , but not
with wine : Thus saith thy Lord the LORD , and thy God that
pleadeth the cause of his people , Behold , I have taken out of thine
hand the cup of trembling , even the dregs of the cup of my fury ; thou

<s> Awake , awake ; put on thy strength , O Zion ; put on thy beautiful

<s> For thus saith the LORD , Ye have sold yourselves for nought ; and

<s> For thus saith the Lord GOD , My people went down aforetime into

<s> Now therefore , what have I here , saith the LORD , that my people

<s> they that rule over them make them to howl ,

<s> Therefore my people shall know my name : therefore they shall know
in that day that I am he that doth speak : behold , it is I . </s>
<s> How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that

<s>  Thy watchmen shall lift up the voice ; with the
voice together shall they sing : for they shall see eye to eye , when

<s> Break forth into joy , sing together , ye waste places of

<s> The LORD hath made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the

<s> Depart ye , depart ye , go ye out from thence , touch no unclean
thing ; go ye out of the midst of her ; be ye clean , that bear the

<s> For ye shall not go out with haste , nor go by flight : for the
LORD will go before you ; and the God of Israel will be your rereward . </s>
<s> Behold , my servant shall deal prudently , he shall be exalted and
extolled , and be very high . </s>
<s> As many were astonied at thee ; his visage was so marred more
than any man , and his form more than the sons of men : So shall
he sprinkle many nations ; the kings shall shut their mouths at him :
for that which had not been told them shall they see ; and that which
they had not heard shall they consider . </s>
<s> Who hath believed our report ? </s>
<s> and to whom is the arm of the LORD
revealed ? </s>
<s>  For he shall grow up before him as a tender plant , and
as a root out of a dry ground : he hath no form nor comeliness ; and
when we shall see him , there is no beauty that we should desire him . </s>
<s> He is despised and rejected of men ; a man of sorrows , and
acquainted with grief : and we hid as it were our faces from him ; he
was despised , and we esteemed him not . </s>
<s> Surely he hath borne our griefs , and carried our sorrows : yet we
did esteem him stricken , smitten of God , and afflicted . </s>
<s> But he was wounded for our transgressions , he was bruised for our
iniquities : the chastisement of our peace was upon him ; and with his
stripes we are healed . </s>
<s> All we like sheep have gone astray ; we have turned every one to
his own way ; and the LORD hath laid on him the iniquity of us all . </s>
<s> He was oppressed , and he was afflicted , yet he opened not his
mouth : he is brought as a lamb to the slaughter , and as a sheep before
her shearers is dumb , so he openeth not his mouth . </s>
<s> He was taken from prison and from judgment : and who shall declare
his generation ? </s>
<s> for he was cut off out of the land of the living : for
the transgression of my people was he stricken . </s>
<s> And he made his grave with the wicked , and with the rich in his
death ; because he had done no violence , neither was any deceit in his
mouth . </s>
<s> Yet it pleased the LORD to bruise him ; he hath put him to grief :
when thou shalt make his soul an offering for sin , he shall see his
seed , he shall prolong his days , and the pleasure of the LORD shall
prosper in his hand . </s>
<s> He shall see of the travail of his soul , and shall be satisfied :
by his knowledge shall my righteous servant justify many ; for he shall
bear their iniquities . </s>
<s> Therefore will I divide him a portion with the great , and he
shall divide the spoil with the strong ; because he hath poured out his
soul unto death : and he was numbered with the transgressors ; and he
bare the sin of many , and made intercession for the transgressors . </s>
<s> Sing , O barren , thou that didst not bear ; break forth into
singing , and cry aloud , thou that didst not travail with child : for
more are the children of the desolate than the children of the married
wife , saith the LORD . </s>
<s> Enlarge the place of thy tent , and let them stretch forth the
curtains of thine habitations : spare not , lengthen thy cords , and

make the desolate cities to be inhabited . </s>
<s> Fear not ; for thou shalt not be ashamed : neither be thou
confounded ; for thou shalt not be put to shame : for thou shalt forget
the shame of thy youth , and shalt not remember the reproach of thy
widowhood any more . </s>
<s> For thy Maker is thine husband ; the LORD of hosts is his name ;
and thy Redeemer the Holy One of Israel ; The God of the whole earth

<s> For the LORD hath called thee as a woman forsaken and grieved in

<s> For a small moment have I forsaken thee ; but with great mercies

<s> In a little wrath I hid my face from thee for a moment ; but with

<s> For this is as the waters of Noah unto me : for as I have sworn

<s> In righteousness shalt thou be established : thou shalt be far

<s> Behold , they shall surely gather together , but not by me :

<s> Ho , every one that thirsteth , come ye to the waters , and he that

<s> For my thoughts are not your thoughts , neither are your ways my

<s> For ye shall go out with joy , and be led forth with peace : the

<s> Blessed is the man that doeth this , and the son of man that

<s> Also the sons of the stranger , that join themselves to the LORD ,

<s> The Lord GOD , which gathereth the outcasts of Israel saith , Yet

<s> All ye beasts of the field , come to devour , yea , all ye beasts in

<s> His watchmen are blind : they are all ignorant , they are all dumb

<s> Yea , they are greedy dogs which can never have enough , and they

<s> Come ye , say they , I will fetch wine , and we will fill ourselves

<s> The righteous perisheth , and no man layeth it to heart : and

<s> He shall enter into peace : they shall rest in their beds , each

<s>  Upon a lofty

<s> And thou wentest to the king with ointment , and didst increase

<s> For thus saith the high and lofty One that inhabiteth eternity ,

<s> For I will not contend for ever , neither will I be always wroth :

<s> Wherefore have we fasted , say they , and thou seest not ? </s>
<s> wherefore

<s> Behold , in

<s> Is it such a fast that I have chosen ? </s>
<s> a day for a man to afflict
his soul ? </s>

<s> If thou turn away thy foot from the sabbath , from doing thy

<s> Behold , the LORD 's hand is not shortened , that it cannot save ;

<s> For your hands are defiled with blood , and your fingers with

<s> None calleth for justice , nor any pleadeth for truth : they trust

<s> They hatch cockatrice ' eggs , and weave the spider 's web : he that

<s> Their webs shall not become garments , neither shall they cover
themselves with their works : their works are works of iniquity , and

<s> Their feet run to evil , and they make haste to shed innocent
blood : their thoughts are thoughts of iniquity ; wasting and

<s> The way of peace they know not ; and there is no judgment in their

<s> Therefore is judgment far from us , neither doth justice overtake
us : we wait for light , but behold obscurity ; for brightness , but we

<s> We grope for the wall like the blind , and we grope as if we had

<s> We roar all like bears , and mourn sore like doves : we look for
judgment , but there is none ; for salvation , but it is far off from us . </s>
<s> For our transgressions are multiplied before thee , and our sins

conceiving and uttering from the heart words of falsehood . </s>
<s> And judgment is turned away backward , and justice standeth afar
off : for truth is fallen in the street , and equity cannot enter . </s>
<s> Yea , truth faileth ; and he that departeth from evil maketh

<s> And he saw that there was no man , and wondered that there was no

<s> For he put on righteousness as a breastplate , and an helmet of

<s>  I have trodden the winepress

<s> For he said , Surely they are my people , children that will not

<s> But they rebelled , and vexed his holy Spirit : therefore he was
turned to be their enemy , and he fought against them . </s>
<s> Then he remembered the days of old , Moses , and his people ,
saying , Where is he that brought them up out of the sea with the
shepherd of his flock ? </s>
<s> where is he that put his holy Spirit within
him ? </s>
<s>  That led them by the right hand of Moses with his glorious
arm , dividing the water before them , to make himself an everlasting
name ? </s>
<s>  That led them through the deep , as an horse in the
wilderness , that they should not stumble ? </s>
<s>  As a beast goeth down
into the valley , the Spirit of the LORD caused him to rest : so didst
thou lead thy people , to make thyself a glorious name . </s>
<s> Look down from heaven , and behold from the habitation of thy
holiness and of thy glory : where is thy zeal and thy strength , the
sounding of thy bowels and of thy mercies toward me ? </s>
<s> are they
restrained ? </s>
<s>  Doubtless thou art our father , though Abraham be
ignorant of us , and Israel acknowledge us not : thou , O LORD , art our
father , our redeemer ; thy name is from everlasting . </s>
<s> O LORD , why hast thou made us to err from thy ways , and hardened
our heart from thy fear ? </s>
<s> Return for thy servants ' sake , the tribes of
thine inheritance . </s>
<s> The people of thy holiness have possessed it but a little while :
our adversaries have trodden down thy sanctuary . </s>
<s> We are thine : thou never barest rule over them ; they were not
called by thy name . </s>
<s> Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens , that thou wouldest come
down , that the mountains might flow down at thy presence , As when
the melting fire burneth , the fire causeth the waters to boil , to make
thy name known to thine adversaries , that the nations may tremble at
thy presence ! </s>
<s>  When thou didst terrible things which we looked
not for , thou camest down , the mountains flowed down at thy presence . </s>
<s> For since the beginning of the world men have not heard , nor
perceived by the ear , neither hath the eye seen , O God , beside thee ,
what he hath prepared for him that waiteth for him . </s>
<s> Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness , those
that remember thee in thy ways : behold , thou art wroth ; for we have
sinned : in those is continuance , and we shall be saved . </s>
<s> But we are all as an unclean thing , and all our righteousnesses
are as filthy rags ; and we all do fade as a leaf ; and our iniquities ,
like the wind , have taken us away . </s>
<s> And there is none that calleth upon thy name , that stirreth up
himself to take hold of thee : for thou hast hid thy face from us , and
hast consumed us , because of our iniquities . </s>
<s> But now , O LORD , thou art our father ; we are the clay , and thou
our potter ; and we all are the work of thy hand . </s>
<s> Be not wroth very sore , O LORD , neither remember iniquity for
ever : behold , see , we beseech thee , we are all thy people . </s>
<s> Thy holy cities are a wilderness , Zion is a wilderness ,
Jerusalem a desolation . </s>
<s> Our holy and our beautiful house , where our fathers praised
thee , is burned up with fire : and all our pleasant things are laid
waste . </s>
<s> Wilt thou refrain thyself for these things , O LORD ? </s>
<s> wilt thou
hold thy peace , and afflict us very sore ? </s>
<s>  I am sought of them
that asked not for me ; I am found of them that sought me not : I said ,
Behold me , behold me , unto a nation that was not called by my name . </s>
<s> I have spread out my hands all the day unto a rebellious people ,
which walketh in a way that was not good , after their own thoughts ;
 A people that provoketh me to anger continually to my face ; that
sacrificeth in gardens , and burneth incense upon altars of brick ; 
Which remain among the graves , and lodge in the monuments , which eat
swine 's flesh , and broth of abominable things is in their vessels ;
 Which say , Stand by thyself , come not near to me ; for I am holier
than thou . </s>
<s> These are a smoke in my nose , a fire that burneth all the
day . </s>
<s> Behold , it is written before me : I will not keep silence , but
will recompense , even recompense into their bosom , Your
iniquities , and the iniquities of your fathers together , saith the
LORD , which have burned incense upon the mountains , and blasphemed me
upon the hills : therefore will I measure their former work into their
bosom . </s>
<s> Thus saith the LORD , As the new wine is found in the cluster , and
one saith , Destroy it not ; for a blessing is in it : so will I do for
my servants ' sakes , that I may not destroy them all . </s>
<s> And I will bring forth a seed out of Jacob , and out of Judah an
inheritor of my mountains : and mine elect shall inherit it , and my
servants shall dwell there . </s>
<s> And Sharon shall be a fold of flocks , and the valley of Achor a
place for the herds to lie down in , for my people that have sought me . </s>
<s> But ye are they that forsake the LORD , that forget my holy
mountain , that prepare a table for that troop , and that furnish the
drink offering unto that number . </s>
<s> Therefore will I number you to the sword , and ye shall all bow
down to the slaughter : because when I called , ye did not answer ; when
I spake , ye did not hear ; but did evil before mine eyes , and did
choose that wherein I delighted not . </s>
<s> Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD , Behold , my servants shall
eat , but ye shall be hungry : behold , my servants shall drink , but ye
shall be thirsty : behold , my servants shall rejoice , but ye shall be
ashamed : Behold , my servants shall sing for joy of heart , but ye
shall cry for sorrow of heart , and shall howl for vexation of spirit . </s>
<s> And ye shall leave your name for a curse unto my chosen : for the
Lord GOD shall slay thee , and call his servants by another name : 
That he who blesseth himself in the earth shall bless himself in the
God of truth ; and he that sweareth in the earth shall swear by the God
of truth ; because the former troubles are forgotten , and because they
are hid from mine eyes . </s>
<s> For , behold , I create new heavens and a new earth : and the
former shall not be remembered , nor come into mind . </s>
<s> But be ye glad and rejoice for ever in that which I create : for ,
behold , I create Jerusalem a rejoicing , and her people a joy . </s>
<s> And I will rejoice in Jerusalem , and joy in my people : and the
voice of weeping shall be no more heard in her , nor the voice of
crying . </s>
<s> There shall be no more thence an infant of days , nor an old man
that hath not filled his days : for the child shall die an hundred
years old ; but the sinner being an hundred years old shall be
accursed . </s>
<s> And they shall build houses , and inhabit them ; and they shall
plant vineyards , and eat the fruit of them . </s>
<s> They shall not build , and another inhabit ; they shall not plant ,
and another eat : for as the days of a tree are the days of my people ,
and mine elect shall long enjoy the work of their hands . </s>
<s> They shall not labour in vain , nor bring forth for trouble ; for
they are the seed of the blessed of the LORD , and their offspring with
them . </s>
<s> And it shall come to pass , that before they call , I will answer ;
and while they are yet speaking , I will hear . </s>
<s> The wolf and the lamb shall feed together , and the lion shall
eat straw like the bullock : and dust shall be the serpent 's meat . </s>
<s> They
shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain , saith the LORD . </s>
<s> Thus saith the LORD , The heaven is my throne , and the earth is my
footstool : where is the house that ye build unto me ? </s>
<s> and where is the
place of my rest ? </s>
<s>  For all those things hath mine hand made , and
all those things have been , saith the LORD : but to this man will I
look , even to him that is poor and of a contrite spirit , and trembleth
at my word . </s>
<s> He that killeth an ox is as if he slew a man ; he that sacrificeth
a lamb , as if he cut off a dog 's neck ; he that offereth an oblation ,
as if he offered swine 's blood ; he that burneth incense , as if he
blessed an idol . </s>
<s> they have chosen their own ways , and their soul delighteth in
their abominations . </s>
<s> I also will choose their delusions , and will bring their fears
upon them ; because when I called , none did answer ; when I spake , they
did not hear : but they did evil before mine eyes , and chose that in
which I delighted not . </s>
<s> Hear the word of the LORD , ye that tremble at his word ; Your
brethren that hated you , that cast you out for my name 's sake , said ,
Let the LORD be glorified : but he shall appear to your joy , and they
shall be ashamed . </s>
<s> A voice of noise from the city , a voice from the temple , a voice
of the LORD that rendereth recompence to his enemies . </s>
<s> Before she travailed , she brought forth ; before her pain came ,
she was delivered of a man child . </s>
<s> Who hath heard such a thing ? </s>
<s> who hath seen such things ? </s>
<s> Shall the
earth be made to bring forth in one day ? </s>
<s> or shall a nation be born at
once ? </s>
<s> for as soon as Zion travailed , she brought forth her children . </s>
<s> Shall I bring to the birth , and not cause to bring forth ? </s>
<s> saith
the LORD : shall I cause to bring forth , and shut the womb ? </s>
<s> saith thy
God . </s>
<s> Rejoice ye with Jerusalem , and be glad with her , all ye that
love her : rejoice for joy with her , all ye that mourn for her : 
That ye may suck , and be satisfied with the breasts of her
consolations ; that ye may milk out , and be delighted with the
abundance of her glory . </s>
<s> For thus saith the LORD , Behold , I will extend peace to her like
a river , and the glory of the Gentiles like a flowing stream : then
shall ye suck , ye shall be borne upon her sides , and be dandled upon
her knees . </s>
<s> As one whom his mother comforteth , so will I comfort you ; and ye
shall be comforted in Jerusalem . </s>
<s> And when ye see this , your heart shall rejoice , and your bones
shall flourish like an herb : and the hand of the LORD shall be known
toward his servants , and his indignation toward his enemies . </s>
<s> For , behold , the LORD will come with fire , and with his chariots
like a whirlwind , to render his anger with fury , and his rebuke with
flames of fire . </s>
<s> For by fire and by his sword will the LORD plead with all flesh :
and the slain of the LORD shall be many . </s>
<s> They that sanctify themselves , and purify themselves in the
gardens behind one tree in the midst , eating swine 's flesh , and the
abomination , and the mouse , shall be consumed together , saith the
LORD . </s>
<s> For I know their works and their thoughts : it shall come , that I
will gather all nations and tongues ; and they shall come , and see my
glory . </s>
<s> And I will set a sign among them , and I will send those that
escape of them unto the nations , to Tarshish , Pul , and Lud , that draw
the bow , to Tubal , and Javan , to the isles afar off , that have not
heard my fame , neither have seen my glory ; and they shall declare my
glory among the Gentiles . </s>
<s> And they shall bring all your brethren for an offering unto the
LORD out of all nations upon horses , and in chariots , and in litters ,
and upon mules , and upon swift beasts , to my holy mountain Jerusalem ,
saith the LORD , as the children of Israel bring an offering in a clean
vessel into the house of the LORD . </s>
<s> And I will also take of them for priests and for Levites , saith
the LORD . </s>
<s> For as the new heavens and the new earth , which I will make ,
shall remain before me , saith the LORD , so shall your seed and your
name remain . </s>
<s> And it shall come to pass , that from one new moon to another ,
and from one sabbath to another , shall all flesh come to worship
before me , saith the LORD . </s>
<s> And they shall go forth , and look upon the carcases of the men
that have transgressed against me : for their worm shall not die ,
neither shall their fire be quenched ; and they shall be an abhorring
unto all flesh . </s>

<s> Then the word of the LORD came unto me , saying , 1 :5 Before I

<s> Hear ye the word of the LORD , O house of Jacob , and all the

<s> Thus saith the LORD , Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom ,
neither let the mighty man glory in his might , let not the rich man
glory in his riches : But let him that glorieth glory in this ,
that he understandeth and knoweth me , that I am the LORD which
exercise lovingkindness , judgment , and righteousness , in the earth :
for in these things I delight , saith the LORD . </s>
<s> Behold , the days come , saith the LORD , that I will punish all
them which are circumcised with the uncircumcised ; Egypt , and

in the utmost corners , that dwell in the wilderness : for all these
nations are uncircumcised , and all the house of Israel are

<s> Hear ye the word which the LORD speaketh unto you , O house of
Israel : Thus saith the LORD , Learn not the way of the heathen ,
and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven ; for the heathen are
dismayed at them . </s>
<s> For the customs of the people are vain : for one cutteth a tree
out of the forest , the work of the hands of the workman , with the axe . </s>
<s> They deck it with silver and with gold ; they fasten it with nails
and with hammers , that it move not . </s>
<s> They are upright as the palm tree , but speak not : they must needs
be borne , because they cannot go . </s>
<s> Be not afraid of them ; for they
cannot do evil , neither also is it in them to do good . </s>
<s> Forasmuch as there is none like unto thee , O LORD ; thou art
great , and thy name is great in might . </s>
<s> Who would not fear thee , O King of nations ? </s>
<s> for to thee doth it
appertain : forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations , and in
all their kingdoms , there is none like unto thee . </s>
<s> But they are altogether brutish and foolish : the stock is a
doctrine of vanities . </s>
<s> Silver spread into plates is brought from Tarshish , and gold from
Uphaz , the work of the workman , and of the hands of the founder : blue
and purple is their clothing : they are all the work of cunning men . </s>
<s> But the LORD is the true God , he is the living God , and an
everlasting king : at his wrath the earth shall tremble , and the
nations shall not be able to abide his indignation . </s>
<s> Thus shall ye say unto them , The gods that have not made the

<s> He hath made the earth by his power , he hath established the

<s> When he uttereth his voice , there is a multitude of waters in

<s> Every man is brutish in his knowledge : every founder is
confounded by the graven image : for his molten image is falsehood , and
there is no breath in them . </s>
<s> They are vanity , and the work of errors : in the time of their
visitation they shall perish . </s>
<s> The portion of Jacob is not like them : for he is the former of
all things ; and Israel is the rod of his inheritance : The LORD of

<s> Gather up thy wares out of the land , O inhabitant of the

<s> For thus saith the LORD , Behold , I will sling out the
inhabitants of the land at this once , and will distress them , that

<s> Woe is me for my hurt ! </s>
<s> my wound is grievous ; but I said , Truly
this is a grief , and I must bear it . </s>
<s> My tabernacle is spoiled , and all my cords are broken : my

<s> For the pastors are become brutish , and have not sought the

<s> Behold , the noise of the bruit is come , and a great commotion

<s> O LORD , I know that the way of man is not in himself : it is not

<s> O LORD , correct me , but with judgment ; not in thine anger , lest

<s> Pour out thy fury upon the heathen that know thee not , and upon

<s> The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD saying , Hear ye

<s> Then answered I ,
and said , So be it , O LORD . </s>

<s> Righteous art thou , O LORD , when I plead with thee : yet let me

<s> How long shall the land mourn , and the herbs of every field

<s> If thou hast run with the footmen , and they have wearied thee ,

<s> And the word of the LORD came unto me the second time , saying ,
 Take the girdle that thou hast got , which is upon thy loins , and

<s> So I went , and hid it by Euphrates , as the LORD commanded me . </s>
<s> And it came to pass after many days , that the LORD said unto me ,

<s> For as the girdle cleaveth to the loins of a man , so have I

<s> Therefore , behold , the days come , saith the LORD , that it shall

<s> Behold , I will send for many fishers , saith the LORD , and they

because they have defiled my land , they have filled mine inheritance

<s> O LORD , my strength , and my fortress , and my refuge in the day
of affliction , the Gentiles shall come unto thee from the ends of the
earth , and shall say , Surely our fathers have inherited lies , vanity ,
and things wherein there is no profit . </s>
<s> Shall a man make gods unto himself , and they are no gods ? </s>
<s> 
Therefore , behold , I will this once cause them to know , I will cause
them to know mine hand and my might ; and they shall know that my name
is The LORD . </s>
<s> The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron , and with the
point of a diamond : it is graven upon the table of their heart , and
upon the horns of your altars ; Whilst their children remember
their altars and their groves by the green trees upon the high hills . </s>
<s> O my mountain in the field , I will give thy substance and all thy
treasures to the spoil , and thy high places for sin , throughout all
thy borders . </s>
<s> And thou , even thyself , shalt discontinue from thine heritage
that I gave thee ; and I will cause thee to serve thine enemies in the
land which thou knowest not : for ye have kindled a fire in mine anger ,
which shall burn for ever . </s>
<s> Thus saith the LORD ; Cursed be the man that trusteth in man , and
maketh flesh his arm , and whose heart departeth from the LORD . </s>
<s> For he shall be like the heath in the desert , and shall not see
when good cometh ; but shall inhabit the parched places in the
wilderness , in a salt land and not inhabited . </s>
<s> Blessed is the man that trusteth in the LORD , and whose hope the
LORD is . </s>
<s> For he shall be as a tree planted by the waters , and that
spreadeth out her roots by the river , and shall not see when heat
cometh , but her leaf shall be green ; and shall not be careful in the
year of drought , neither shall cease from yielding fruit . </s>
<s> The heart is deceitful above all things , and desperately wicked :
who can know it ? </s>
<s>  I the LORD search the heart , I try the reins ,
even to give every man according to his ways , and according to the
fruit of his doings . </s>
<s> As the partridge sitteth on eggs , and hatcheth them not ; so he
that getteth riches , and not by right , shall leave them in the midst
of his days , and at his end shall be a fool . </s>
<s> A glorious high throne from the beginning is the place of our
sanctuary . </s>
<s> O LORD , the hope of Israel , all that forsake thee shall be
ashamed , and they that depart from me shall be written in the earth ,
because they have forsaken the LORD , the fountain of living waters . </s>
<s> Heal me , O LORD , and I shall be healed ; save me , and I shall be
saved : for thou art my praise . </s>
<s> Behold , they say unto me , Where is the word of the LORD ? </s>
<s> let it
come now . </s>
<s> As for me , I have not hastened from being a pastor to follow
thee : neither have I desired the woeful day ; thou knowest : that which
came out of my lips was right before thee . </s>
<s> Be not a terror unto me : thou art my hope in the day of evil . </s>
<s> Let them be confounded that persecute me , but let not me be
confounded : let them be dismayed , but let not me be dismayed : bring
upon them the day of evil , and destroy them with double destruction . </s>
<s> Thus said the LORD unto me ; Go and stand in the gate of the
children of the people , whereby the kings of Judah come in , and by the

Judah , and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem , that enter in by these

burden on the sabbath day , nor bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem ;
 Neither carry forth a burden out of your houses on the sabbath

commanded your fathers . </s>
<s> But they obeyed not , neither inclined their ear , but made their
neck stiff , that they might not hear , nor receive instruction . </s>
<s> And it shall come to pass , if ye diligently hearken unto me ,

 Then shall there enter into the gates of this city kings and

<s> And they shall come from the cities of Judah , and from the

<s> But if ye will not hearken unto me to hallow the sabbath day ,

<s> The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD , saying , 
Arise , and go down to the potter 's house , and there I will cause thee
to hear my words . </s>
<s> Then I went down to the potter 's house , and , behold , he wrought a
work on the wheels . </s>
<s> And the vessel that he made of clay was marred in the hand of the
potter : so he made it again another vessel , as seemed good to the
potter to make it . </s>
<s> Then the word of the LORD came to me , saying , O house of
Israel , cannot I do with you as this potter ? </s>
<s> saith the LORD . </s>
<s> Behold ,
as the clay is in the potter 's hand , so are ye in mine hand , O house
of Israel . </s>
<s> At what instant I shall speak concerning a nation , and concerning
a kingdom , to pluck up , and to pull down , and to destroy it ; If

<s> And at what instant I shall speak concerning a nation , and
concerning a kingdom , to build and to plant it ; If it do evil in

wherewith I said I would benefit them . </s>
<s> Now therefore go to , speak to the men of Judah , and to the

<s> And they said , There is no hope : but we will walk after our own

<s> Will a man leave the snow of Lebanon which cometh from the rock

<s> or shall the cold flowing waters that come from another

<s>  Because my people hath forgotten me , they

<s> for they have digged a pit

<s> Therefore deliver up their children to the famine , and pour out

<s> Let a cry be heard from their houses , when thou shalt bring a

<s> Thus saith the LORD , Go and get a potter 's earthen bottle , and

<s> Because they have forsaken me , and have estranged this place , and

 Therefore , behold , the days come , saith the LORD , that this place

<s> And I will make void the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem in this

<s> And I will make this city desolate , and an hissing ; every one

<s> And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the

<s> Then shalt thou break the bottle in the sight of the men that go

<s> Thus will I do unto this place , saith the LORD , and to the

<s> Then came Jeremiah from Tophet , whither the LORD had sent him to

<s> Now Pashur the son of Immer the priest , who was also chief

<s> O LORD , thou hast deceived me , and I was deceived ; thou art

<s> Then I said , I will not make mention of him , nor speak any more

say they , and we will report it . </s>
<s> All my familiars watched for my

<s> But the LORD is with me as a mighty terrible one : therefore my

<s> But , O LORD of hosts , that triest the righteous , and seest the

<s> Wherefore came I forth out of the womb to see labour and sorrow ,

<s>  The word which came

<s> Then said Jeremiah unto them , Thus shall ye say to Zedekiah :

<s> Mine heart within me is broken because of the prophets ; all my
bones shake ; I am like a drunken man , and like a man whom wine hath
overcome , because of the LORD , and because of the words of his
holiness . </s>
<s> For the land is full of adulterers ; for because of swearing the
land mourneth ; the pleasant places of the wilderness are dried up , and
their course is evil , and their force is not right . </s>
<s> For both prophet and priest are profane ; yea , in my house have I
found their wickedness , saith the LORD . </s>
<s> Wherefore their way shall be unto them as slippery ways in the
darkness : they shall be driven on , and fall therein : for I will bring
evil upon them , even the year of their visitation , saith the LORD . </s>
<s> And I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria ; they
prophesied in Baal , and caused my people Israel to err . </s>
<s> I have seen also in the prophets of Jerusalem an horrible thing :

of evildoers , that none doth return from his wickedness ; they are all

<s> Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts concerning the prophets ;

<s> Thus saith the LORD of hosts , Hearken not unto the words of the

<s> They say still unto them that despise me , The LORD hath said , Ye

<s> For who hath stood in the counsel of the LORD , and hath

<s> who hath marked his word , and heard it ? </s>
<s> Behold , a whirlwind of the LORD is gone forth in fury , even a

<s> The anger of the LORD shall not return , until he have executed ,
and till he have performed the thoughts of his heart : in the latter

<s> I have not sent these prophets , yet they ran : I have not spoken

<s> But if they had stood in my counsel , and had caused my people to

<s> Am I a God at hand , saith the LORD , and not a God afar off ? </s>

<s> the LORD . </s>
<s> Do not I fill heaven and earth ? </s>
<s> saith the LORD . </s>
<s> I have heard what the prophets said , that prophesy lies in my

<s> How long shall this be in the heart of the prophets that

<s> yea , they are prophets of the deceit of their own
heart ; Which think to cause my people to forget my name by their
